author: {'steamid': '76561198032345325', 'num_games_owned': 2727, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1449572285}
review: I am a 45 -year -old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father raising my son, who is now 14 years old. My son won this game from his uncle, so we installed him on his computer and he started playing. Until the end of the week he had 24 hours in this game. This was horrible for me, because it was hard to find ways to spend time with my son, because he is always with friends or just watching Youtube. So I decided to do a Steam account and get this game to see if I could play beside him. I bought the game, chose my skin and world and started playing, but I was stuck in what you should do. I asked my son for help and he organized a game for me to participate. I loved it, because it was the best time I spent with my son since my wife died. Since then, this game has approached me and my son again and now we spend time together away from home as well. This game reminded me that there is fun in everything, and I brought many happy memories to me and my son.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962733287', 'num_games_owned': 2695, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1553, 'last_played': 1666795835}
review:
[h1]Spielbewertung von TrophyHunter[/h1]

Dieses Spiel habe ich bereits letztes Jahr gekauft, da das Spiel durch seine vorschau Bilder sehr interessant wirkte. Als ich dann die Bewertungen gesehen habe, konnte ich das ganze nicht glauben und machte mir dementsprechend ein eigenes Bild davon. Was soll ich sagen...

"Arma Tactics" ist ein taktisches Strategiespiel, das von "Bohemia Interactive" entwickelt wurde und auf Handy sowie PC verfÃ¼gbar ist. Das Spiel bietet zwar eine Vielzahl von Missionen in verschiedenen Umgebungen, jedoch haben die Missionen oft Ã¤hnliche Ziele, was dazu fÃ¼hrt, dass der Spieler oft die gleichen taktischen Entscheidungen treffen muss, was das Spiel sehr monoton macht. Die Steuerung des Spiels ist sehr simpel und die MenÃ¼s sind teils unÃ¼bersichtlich, was das Spielerlebnis etwas beeintrÃ¤chtigt. Was ist eigentlich mit der KI falsch? Eine Spezialeinheit trifft aus 2 Metern Distanz den Gegner nicht..., dass ist schon an der ein oder anderen Stelle sehr frustrierend. Desweiteren ist die Kameraperspektive des Ã¶fteren in HÃ¤userkÃ¤mpfen verbugt, wo durch man teilweise nichts sehen kann. Die Grafik des Spiels ist zwar fÃ¼r ein "Handy-Game" detailliert, aber die Umgebungen sind oft zu dunkel und unÃ¼bersichtlich. Das Spiel bietet auch keine echte Story oder Charakterentwicklung, weshalb der Spieler keine richtige Verbindung zu den Charakteren aufbauen kann. Das Game hat aktuell 22 Errungenschaften, welche den Spieler teils sehr fordern kÃ¶nnen. Der Preis betrÃ¤gt aktuell 6,99â‚¬ auf dem PC und 3,99â‚¬ auf dem Handy.

Ich persÃ¶nlich finde, dass "Arma Tactics" jetzt kein ultra schlechtes Strategiespiel ist. Klar, das Spiel hat seine Macken und Probleme, aber habt ihr jemals ein Spiel erlebt, welches von Anfang an ohne Probleme, ohne Bugs oder anderen StÃ¶rungen verÃ¶ffentlicht wurde? Ich nicht... . Macht euch einfach ein eigenes Bild von dem Spiel. Ich werde es jedenfalls weiter empfehlen, zwar nicht mit der besten Sternebewertung, aber es wird auf jeden Fall positiv bewertet, weil spielen kann man es trotzdem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198884296335', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1656358259}
review:
[h1] This is one of the worst Arma games ever made [/h1]

The biggest issues with this game
[list]
    [*]The Levels are heavily unbalanced 
    [*]Enemies Can see you through walls
    [*]Cover doesn't protect you from bullets
    [*]Throwing grenades and other thrown objects aren't able to be used in random areas (commonly indoors a
    [*]There isn't much content anyways with only 4 weapons and a knife
    [*]Stealth is basically impossible as enemies can see you through walls
[/list]

some issues
- The graphics aren't great
- The GUI also isn't great but its okay
- The game is a buggy mess of code

comments:
this is what i would like to see from a game a few weeks into development not a "fully" finished game
this is the only game I've ever disliked to the point of writing a bad review
look for any other turn-based strategy game, it will probably be better in every way compared to this one

author: {'steamid': '76561198257488224', 'num_games_owned': 2173, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1619877748}
review:
Really enjoy this back on phone and tablet it's great to see it on here too.

However on here it seems a little ill balanced as you can be spotted by enemies who couldn't actually spot you and there better shots there are issues but I am not going to bitch about them as the games OK

Over all it's still fun but a bit frustrating at times & it's really good to play it on a bigger screen 

I would Get it on sale with a heavy discount and don't expect XCOM Or Gears Tactics style quality or standards

author: {'steamid': '76561198107212373', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1562390310}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034095420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1656291191}
review:
It's bad. Really bad. Imagine an x-com clone that is somehow worse than XCOM: UFO (in all terms except visuals). It has all the negative quirks of XCOM (old and modern) games, but with none of the quality-of-life features. 
You can't save (and therefore savescum).
If a single squadmate dies, you gotta restart.
You spend your XP points exclusively from the main menu...
So many weird decisions that make this one of the worst xcom clones out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966274230', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1499145778}
review:
I honestly expected a lot more from Bohemia. They are so talented, yet they fell so hard in this title. My major issues with this title are similar to others who also wished they could have posted a more positive review, but couldn't do it, because it wouldn't do the game justice. 

- The environments are very bland. Texture work, shading, and even the locations themselves leave a lot to be desired. There's nothing particularly interesting or exciting here. 
- The story and campaign are quite generic and not enticing or engaging. 
- The bugs.... oh my the bugs. They are everywhere, someone call an exterminator. 
- And lastly, the interface feels like this made for a tablet and not a PC. It's ugly, clunky, and unintuitive. 

I was really hoping for a better experience here, since I love Bohemia's other titles. Unfortunately this one misses the mark, even when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198918248521', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 3318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3317, 'last_played': 1648452637}
review: Addicting and fun, i have been playing this game for hours. My biggest problem is the lack of gun selection and upgrades. the game flows well at the beginning and has the problem of hitting the peak of gameplay quickly. Even with this con, I still can't stop playing for a few hours a week.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992974556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1631514460}
review:
AI is nearly omniscient with 100% accuracy regardless of any cover i take.
All controls from character to camera feel un-intuitive and/or lacking.
Playing around in menus before i even started the training mission i was able reset a squad members base stats and nothing got refunded so hes stuck at 0 everything instead of his starting stats and no way to put them back. even a full reinstall didnt help.

I believe i got this game for free through a bundle program and it still wasn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988000877', 'num_games_owned': 1603, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1619094751}
review:
I've put this one off for way too long because I really wanted to like Arma Tactics. Conceptually, most of the design makes sense but ultimately they missed the mark.

To understand Arma Tactics it's important to realize that this was a mobile game build for short bursts of strategy. It doesn't have the depth of X-Com and it's limited to 10 story missions. But what it brought to the table was a "Random Mission" mode that gives you a quick burst of strategy to gain money and XP for your soldiers.  You can play the story missions while sitting home, but you can fit the random missions into 10 minute bursts while you're out. 

I loved this and, in fact, loved the demo on my phone back in 2013.

The tactics aren't overwhelming as you'd expect from an Arma game, but extremely light and arcade-y. You get 2 action points, the ability to aim/shoot one of a few weapons/items. If you don't fire, the AP is saved for overwatch.  As you complete missions you earn experience to train your soldiers into overpowered killing machines.

And this is what separates the demo I played from the full release. For some reason, the demo awarded about 10x the experience per mission. While definitely too high, it had a feeling of progress that kept me playing. The final release instead feels like they don't want to me to train. It's a darn grind.

This is made worse by the existence of countless bugs. Everything from freezing in the tutorial, to the UI getting stuck, to a mission where the secondary stealth objective is impossible because on of their updates broke the line-of-sight for the level! 

I've avoided writing this review and returned to this game multiple times now but I just can't tell you that its worth buying. There are too many good options these days to recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043991646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1601433577}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1612008451}
review:
This is a mobile ported turn based tactical game released with the ArmA branding, but this shouldn't be confused with the successful FPS milsim game.   It's more like a "tacticool" X-Com ripoff. 

As usual, mobile gaming makes gaming worse for everyone.   This is a really mediocre game, dumbed down and shoddily balanced, but let's face is, mobile peasants don't have high standards.  

I used to have a lot of respect for Bohemia Interactive, but after seeing this, all that goodwill is gone.  Bohemia deliberately set out to screw PC gamers here.  On Steam, this is $9 USD, on app stores, it's $5 USD.  Bohemia should know PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay a premium for a mobile game just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam.  Bohemia should know better, their lack of integrity and ethics here are extremely disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125861813', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1438517577}
review: This game has a poorly designed user interface, confusing mechanics, a glitchy engine, unappealing art design, outdated graphics from 2005, and a dull campaign. It is yet another poorly ported game for tablets, best to be forgotten. If you are looking for a game of this type, Breach and Clear does it much better. This game is an insult to the Arma franchise and should be avoided.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094206994', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1613827900}
review: I originally gave this an 'Awful', but after giving it a second chance it's still bad. HOWEVER through it's many bugs and issues (disappearing-reappearing enemies, spotted across the map from behind a building, etc). I found myself becoming determined to find different routes to complete the missions. It's got some kind of charm about it, but it should definitely be a free game. I can't recommend buying it. Trade for it if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016046767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1614, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1599104781}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985975371', 'num_games_owned': 2176, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1597087105}
review:
Just don't, I don't find any redeeming qualities of this one. While on mobile it sort of works, on PC it's got bad UI, unresponsive systems, sub-mediocre plotline. It just doesn't bring joy. 

I tried the first mission and had to give up. While the training went fairly well the UI is so very clunky. Getting characters to go where you click is an effort in itself and doing any actions has nearly zero feedback so part of the time you don't know if you clicked something properly or not. I tried using the gamepad, but that was a joke with some obscure scheme and having to guess what to press at each point.. I guess one could get accustomed to it, but I opted for the mouse which at least showed where I was trying to click.

I don't even want to spend too much of time writing this review. Spare your money for something else.

review:

En la primera media hora de juego lo empecÃ© con ganas por la idea del juego ya que me atraÃ­a la estrategia, pero poco a poco esas ganas se convirtieron en ansias por desinstalar el juego. Por que? Por que bÃ¡sicamente despuÃ©s de terminar el entrenamiento te meten en una partida ya difÃ­cil de ganar con las habilidades que tengas. El sistema de progresiÃ³n esta roto, y solo lo intentaron arreglar con un mapa que es solo de experiencia (no da crÃ©ditos) por lo que el equipamiento serÃ¡ ya difÃ­cil de conseguir hasta que termines la primera misiÃ³n. Con lo cual te invita a farmear luego con ese mapa, lo que me queda tedioso, Esto podrÃ­a mejorarse aÃ±adiendo mÃ¡s niveles mÃ¡s sencillos, pero quizÃ¡s lo volverÃ¡ tambiÃ©n mÃ¡s repetitivo.
Otra razÃ³n por la cual te invita mas a farmear es la primera y Ãºnica misiÃ³n real de sigilo la cual se encuentra rota ya que el 90% del tiempo 5 npcs enemigos encuentran mirÃ¡ndose entre ellos y necesitas 4 rifles francotirador con silenciador, no podras hacer nada si te hubieras pasado las dos misiones anteriores a la primera y sin pasar por las de farmeo lo cual ya me deja pensando que se diseÃ±o un poco para hacer relleno innecesario.
Al cabo de 5 horas me encontraba intentando hacerme ya todos los logros para no volver a tener razones para volver a instalÃ¡rmelo.
En resumen, se le veÃ­a intenciÃ³n, pero la ejecuciÃ³n ha sido pÃ©sima.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004226735', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 3017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3017, 'last_played': 1434786532}
review:
I might have a lot of hours registered but let me tell you: Arma Tactics is just simply a bad game. A bad flawed copy of much better tactical games such as Jagged Alliance or X-COM. I don't mind the simple graphics, but I do care about the tactical part of the game which is nearly inexistant here... 
The AI is quite dumb: most enemies rush you down and line up behind each other. The combat system is so unpolished that you just can't call this a turn based strategy or a tactics game. The interface is also a piece of useless junk, and it seems to be optimized for touchscreens and not for the mouse. If it was a free smartphone game I wouldn't mind, but Bohemia Interactive missed the mark with this game and shouldn't ask money for this sorry excuse of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045712094', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1586519455}
review: Congrats, your game is so terrible i'm actually writing my first review ever on it. I don't know what I expected, I picked it up sooooo long ago, saw it in my library and thought, you know what I'll give it a try. Not only does the game look god awful, it somehow manages to play worse than it looks. The movement system is a deep fried bag of shit, any sort of movement next to an action is damn near impossible for reasons unknown to me. Why not just let the player double click the action within their movement range to perform it? Why can't I move INFRONT of the crate I open, why do I have to sidestep it, and then open it? Even the tutorial mission feels about as smooth as the operation of a fucking Zip 22. I don't know how much this costs anymore, nor do I care, this feels and plays like an early access game and the dev team should be ashamed of themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998029976', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1545777932}
review:
Started "Boot Camp", the tutorial.
Followed green arrows that pointed inside a kill house (looks like a MOUT setting).
Nothing happened after like 10 turns wandering all over the area, so I went back outside.
Suddenly an AI ally appears inside where I stood 5 turns earlier, I get control of it.
AI enemies appear and I am informed they can't hurt my AI teammate right now.
Dispatched the enemies while already walking my other soldier over.
"Oh no, Marco--the other soldier--has been hit! You have to revive him!"

Okay, but he's still 2 turns away, but I'm sure that doesn't matter since this is the tutori--
Marco falls over and dies.

Mission failed.

Yeeaaah, I really feel like I should demand my money back for this.

And don't even dare compare this game to Jagged Alliance or XCOM (the old ones) or any other turn based action games out there. This isn't even functioning properly like a game and from what little I have seen of it it has about the 1% the complexity of a typical turn based action game; that is assuming the game does function properly at times.

Just... just stay away from this... this awful entity.

De comeÃ§o o jogo se mostra entediante, difÃ­cil de entender e com poucos recursos, o que nÃ£o desperta o interesse do jogador para continuar. A movimentaÃ§Ã£o dos personagens Ã© muito bÃ¡sica e nÃ£o corresponde Ã  realidade tÃ¡tica de uma operaÃ§Ã£o CQB , no qual deveria ter a opÃ§Ã£o de o personagem se movimentar no pronto 2 ou pronto 3 , em Arma Tactics o personagem sÃ³ corre. As opÃ§Ãµes de engajamento tÃ¡tico, Breaching, tiro sincronizado, entradas e outros recursos tÃ¡ticos sÃ£o inexistentes, tudo dependendo exclusivamente do orquestramento de aÃ§Ãµes do prÃ³prio jogador que consiste em clickar e arrastar o personagem para posiÃ§Ã£o, dispondo de poucos recursos como colocar silenciador, uso de kit de primeiros socorros, estÃ¢ncia defensiva e recarregar.

E mantÃ©m assim quase por todo a gameplay, nÃ£o existe elementos de interaÃ§Ã£o no cenÃ¡rio o que certamente aumentaria a experiÃªncia do jogo, a Ãºnica coisa que muda sÃ£o os cenÃ¡rios e os inimigos, mas de resto Ã© um Ctrl+C e Ctrl+V ,os bugs existem , a histÃ³ria e a situaÃ§Ã£o geral de cada missÃ£o sÃ£o passadas nas entrelinhas e tambÃ©m nÃ£o desperta muito interesse ao jogador, de modo que sÃ£o quase descartÃ¡veis.

Arma Tactics Ã© um jogo no mÃ­nimo bom para smartphones, mas quando entra para o mercado de jogos para PC, no qual existem vÃ¡rios tÃ­tulos excelentes como SWAT , Breach and Clear,XCOM e atÃ© jogos antigos como a sÃ©rie Commandos, nÃ£o se demonstra a altura quanto. author: {'steamid': '76561198083480066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1456570447}
review:
A massive disappointment.
Could have been a great spin-off, as well as a wonderful Turn-Based-Tactics title. 
Any good potential gets overshadowed by either messy, or downright boring gameplay rather quickly (i.e. a completely unintuitive and borderline broken line of sight system, rendering a stealthy approach to certain situations utterly impossible). You might notice several design choices which suit games intended for mobile devices and indeed, Arma Tactics was initially published on mobile, lazely ported to PC shortly afterwards and it shows. Oh boy... it shows. 
Any redeeming qualities are purely in the eye of the beholder and way too few either way.
Eventually Arma Tactics can't be recommended to fans of the Armed Assault franchise in general, as well as Turn-Based-Tactics die hards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033824219', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1539752786}
review:
One of the worst games I've ever played. 
Impossibly hard: if one person loses their health (something that should incapacitate and require you to heal them within a certain number of turns which happens in the tutorial) then you lose the mission. No ability to heal them, no continuing on without them. You lose and have to restart. 
Experience is slow: you don't get very much experience/ cash (which you buy things with) from what I can tell, which isn't a big deal, except that health packs, grenades, and several other items are CONSUMED with each use! 
Moving fire: enemy units will sometimes shoot at you if they catch one of your guys crossing their lining of sight, again, not a big deal. Except, that the same is NOT true of your troops! The bad guys have no problem running up point blank (or even behind) your guys and giving them an up close and personal shot to the head (though, this usually isn't an instakill). 
Ineffectual cover: cover makes practically no difference. Even when in cover and using the special cover/shield task (this takes movement points and it is supposed to reduce the enemy's chance of getting a hit) you will still get shot most of the time. Maybe it just reduces damage.
Line of sight: this one is a pretty big deal. If you sneak up on a room of enemies when they are alerted, perhaps taking cover on the outside of the door, you will be spotted and subsequently shot next turn.
Last comment: This is the first game of the genre that I have played and I actually like the format and the strategy, but this game is tremendously awful. DON'T buy it for any price, not even for free!

P.S.
Alerted just means after one of your guys have been spotted, which could have been anywhere else on the map and it doesn't seem to go away.

review:
Let me sum up this game for those who are figuring out if you should buy it...

go through tutorial rather easily.  

Start mission one.  run for about 3 turns, find and enemy and kill a few.  Then immediately get gang fked by a bunch more enemies that converge on your position and kill one guy, thus ending the mission.  Played first mission quite a few times and each time this is what happened.  Honestly, they need a better difficulty level.  Its like you haver two choices, get fked or get fked royally.  Just wasnt fun and theres no way around this.  you have guys on rooftops killing you and also guys running up to your spot 2 or 3 at a time.  Just a shit game.  Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194587166', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1534691687}
review:
[h1] Rating: 5 out of 10 [/h1]
As a turn-based tactics game fan, this game is average among all the TBT games. The game is short: 15 hrs in, and I got all the achievements (although the achievement wonâ€™t count towards total achievement status)

[h1]The Good: [/h1]
There are a few weapons and equipment to choose from: Carbines (all-around weapon), sniper (long range), LMG (uhh, I do not see specific use of this, as you cannot suppress enemy), shotgun (short range 1 shot 1 kill guaranteed), flash-bang (lower accuracy and add range penalty), med-kit (God items-you can heal any type of damage with this), frag grenade, smoke grenade (lower the chance of being hit), morphine (payday 2 equivalent of â€˜get the fuck upâ€™), claymore (boom), and remote claymore (good for ambush, it brings a smile to my face when AI gather together and 1 claymore takes care of all of them).

Some weapons have a silencer. If you want to go stealth, it is totally doable (except for a mission where the silencer is disabled)

Each of your operatives is pre-assigned some skills to fill a role in the team and can equip up to 5 different kinds of weapons (1) and equipment (4). You can lv up your operatives to be a specialist on certain things or have all-around skills. 

The graphics are not bad, but also no highlight 

The soundtrack is fitting. 

[h1]The Bad: [/h1]
Oh man, where should I startâ€¦ This game has many that prevent me from recommending it.

[u] Game-breaking bug: [/u]
game stuck on the enemy turn even if they all finished moving, the only way to continue to play is to force close the game through task manager and restart

[u] The cover system: [/u]
Does not seem to work. AI can still shoot you no matter what. Hit chance seems to be determined purely by weapon type and distance.

[u] AI: [/u]
[olist]
    [*]Rush to you in a straight line without any tactic. This allows you to set up a remote claymore and take care of 5+ enemies in one click. 
    [*]AI is also shortsighted and astigmatic. You can see them, but they cannot see you. This allows some ridiculous action.
    [*] In stealth, when you one patrol, another patrol near him wonâ€™t notice (unless they are facing each other). So I guess seeing friends being shot or seeing a dead body means nothing.
[/olist]

[u] Gun firing animation: [/u]
[olist]
    [*] Sometimes when your operative fires at the sky, the enemy in front of him gets shot. Magic right! Magneto, or how else can you explain the magically curved bullet!
    [*] You can clearly shoot through walls
[/olist]

[u] Character model: [/u]
Only one model is used. Then how do you distinguish them in your team menu? Add a mustache!

[u] Voice acting [/u] 
voice acting does not seem to fit the situation. One particularly is awkward in all his lines

[u] Using Armaâ€™s name but no mil-sim: [/u]
Fire a sniper rifle with a silencer in a room to kill one enemy. The other enemy in the same room wonâ€™t hear anything.

[h1]Overall, I wonâ€™t recommend this game. The cons overwhelm the pros. If you really run out of TBS, you can give it a try. [/h1]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198038633446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1530809253}
review:
Really quite frustrating and tedious to play compared to other TBS and RTS games

The entire cover system seems pointless when enemies can shoot you whether you're behind cover or not (just seems to be pure chance/distance when it comes to being shot by enemies).

If one of your squad dies you will lose the mission and have to start it again, I found it very difficult to even get past the first section of the first mission after the tutorial on the default difficulty.

Movement is very slow and tedious in terms of where you are allowed to move as well as where you are allowed to take cover, some place you can take cover and some you can't, even if it would seem like it'd be an obvious place to take cover.

The selection of inventory items is a bit of an obscure system of primarily using the left mouse button, I kept accidentally opening the action menu when trying to move characters.

Throwing grenades where you want them to go is not easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107885789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1528820082}
review:
Despite all the negative reviews, I thought to myself: "It's XCOM in a modern warfare setting. It can't be THAT bad.". Sadly, I was wrong. Game is barely playable, not just because of some bugs, but also because the mechanics are clunky and inconsistent. 

Regardless, I just wasn't having much fun in the very brief time I spent playing it, and that's coming from someone who is often able to find at least some enjoyment in even the worst games. Thankfully I got it as part of the Arma Humble Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031621784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1528031945}
review:
Rating: 2 out of 10

I like the arma franchise and turnbased tactics. 
Jagged Alliance and Xcom are some of my favourite games.
This game is a casual mobile port game, a dumbed down XCOM, 
copying the formula of the new Xcom reboot and it's failures while omitting it's strength.

Pros:
+ serviceable graphics

Cons (endless):
- casual gameplay without much tactical options
- unresponsive mobile port userinterface
- dumb a.i.
- boring story and atmosphere
- bad voiceacting
- no arma mil-sim-gameplay
...

author: {'steamid': '76561198116517331', 'num_games_owned': 3235, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1524777821}
review:
This game is playable but it has significant problems:

-experience gain is too low
-money gain is too low, and you need to buy all of your gear other than the basic assault rifle
-a soldier that loses all health can either die instantly, ending the mission, or start bleeding out or is able to be revived.  This can cause the tutorial to end in failure.
-the missions should've been shorter and more numerous rather than long and few
-damage dealt is highly variable and unpredictable
-the game hangs or soft locks on occasion

review:
arma tactics Ã¨ beh, arma 2 con piÃ¹ problemi piÃ¹ bug piÃ¹ glitch ma Ã¨ uno strategico, il che rende le cose meno divertenti e piÃ¹ frustranti, ne volete un'esempio ? allora, mentre faccio avanzare i personaggi e si mettono dietro un riparo vengono colpiti dai nemici perchÃ¨ troppo "pigri" da accucciarsi invece di stare alzato e esporre la testa al nemico.
ah i nemici, mira infallibile a centinaia e turni infiniti, manco fosse xcom cazzo.
devo essere sincero a me personalmente il titolo non ha fatto schifo in tutti i sensi perÃ² Ã¨ davvero uno strategico penoso quasi indegno di essere definito tale, gli sviluppatori con qualche accortezza e qualche riguardo in piÃ¹ per le meccaniche e i bug avrebbero potuto fare di arma tactics il titolo di strategia di eccellenza della bohemia, invece hanno preferito fare come fare come dean hall e dayz standalone, ovvero abbandonarlo al suo destino funesto ovvero quello di esser gettato nel dimenticatoio, e fa arrabbiare dico perchÃ¨ come tutti i giochi che si trovano nel dimenticatoio aveva e ha ancora oggi un sacco di potenziale ma viene dimenticato a causa di difetti tecnici causati dalla pigrizia degli sviluppatori.
purtroppo Ã¨ brutto dirlo ma, se avete soldi da spendere andate su altri giochi, oppure aspettate i saldi estivi o invernali perchÃ¨ il titolo non vale a prezzo pieno, al massimo due euro in queste condizioni, e dimenticatevi degli update oramai Ã¨ troppo vecchio per questo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115048559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1514405700}
review:
En primer lugar para poder contextualizar adecuadamente mi anÃ¡lisis personal sobre Arma Tactics decir que he jugado desde mediados de la dÃ©cada de los 90 a un gran nÃºmero de juegos de tipo estrategia por turnos y estrategia en tiempo real, me enganchÃ© al gÃ©nero con los juegos de la franquicia XCOM â€¦ desde sus comienzos en los aÃ±os 90. Franquicia que sigo con extraordinario interÃ©s desde sus comienzos con Microsprose hasta la actualidad.

Inicialmente he tenido muchas reticencias sobre Arma Tactics debido a:

- Es el primer juego de esta serie basado en estrategia por turnos.
- Comentarios de la comunidad mayormente negativos.

Todo esto me ha llevado a no instalarlo hasta estas navidades. Las promociones de Steam, a un precio inferior a 1,5â‚¬ y mi predilecciÃ³n por la estrategia por turnos tipo XCOM me han animado a adquirirlo.

Tras la instalaciÃ³n comencÃ© a jugarlo con gran interÃ©s, y tras las horas necesarias (no muchas, en torno a 20) invertidas en jugar todas las campaÃ±as que incluye, los mapas individuales y todos los logros Steam, expongo a la Comunidad mis apreciaciones sobre el juego con el Ã¡nimo de que puedan aportar algo.

- Como en la mayorÃ­a de este tipo de juegos hay dos grandes partes: GestiÃ³n de bases y misiones.

- GestiÃ³n de Bases: Realmente solo hay una Ãºnica â€œbaseâ€, en este caso, campamento, y la gestiÃ³n de esta es casi inexistente. Se limita a: Seleccionar misiÃ³n a realizar, gestiÃ³n de soldados (Equipo) y equipamiento del campamento (armerÃ­a).

- GestiÃ³n de Base: Seleccionar misiÃ³n. Hay 2 campaÃ±as de 5 misiones cada una y la posibilidad de seleccionar una misiÃ³n parametrizÃ¡ndola: Tipo (Defensa, Huida, bÃºsqueda de un terrorista) y Escenario (uno de los 10 utilizados en las misiones de campaÃ±a). Resumiendo el desarrollo del juego es bastante elemental (dos minicampaÃ±as independientes la una de la otra de 5 misiones cada una).

- GestiÃ³n de Base: Soldados (Equipo). Nuevamente â€¦. Tremendamente elemental. La PersonalizaciÃ³n de personajes es Inexistente (No se puede cambiar el nombre, el aspecto â€¦ ni siquiera el nÃºmero de miembros o su tipo). Los puntos de experiencia se pueden acumular en experiencia del manejo de armas, combate sin armas o en movimiento). Nada mÃ¡s â€¦

- GestiÃ³n de Base: Tipos de arma y compra (ArmerÃ­a). TambiÃ©n limitadÃ­simo, 4 armas (fusil, escopeta, ametralladora ligera y rifle de francotirador) mÃ¡s algunos explosivos y botiquÃ­n. Los crÃ©ditos para su compra se obtienen al cumplimentar misiones.

- GestiÃ³n de Base: InvestigaciÃ³n, fabricaciÃ³n, informaciÃ³n, despliegues y formaciÃ³n de equipos: NI SIQUIERA EXISTEN LOS CONCEPTOS EN EL JUEGO.

- Misiones: El inicio de las misiones vuelve a mostrar lo limitadÃ­simo de este juego al tener que equipar los soldados (5 ranuras fijas, 1 para el arma y el resto para explosivos, botiquines, etc. Una vez iniciada la misiÃ³n el juego refleja, el a mi entender Ãºnico aspecto â€œpositivo del juegoâ€ â€¦ Respeta la dinÃ¡mica habitual de la estrategia por turnos con los turnos de acciÃ³n y la selecciÃ³n de tipo de disparo. La variedad y la IA de los enemigos, es casi inexistente â€¦ Casi todos iguales y con movimientos mÃ¡s que predecibles.

- TraducciÃ³n al Castellano. Realizada en torno a un 75% (el 25% restante estÃ¡ en inglÃ©s). Siendo lo mÃ¡s positivo posible sin faltar a la realidad mi opiniÃ³n es que es â€¦ MUY mejorable (llamar â€œAmetralladoraâ€ a una escopeta de toda la vida â€¦ creo que esto lo puede resumir este aspecto del juego, por no extenderme).

- AmbientaciÃ³n y ContextualizaciÃ³n: Casi inexistente. Se reduce a unas cuantas lÃ­neas e texto.

ConclusiÃ³n: Lamentablemente tengo que hacer una valoraciÃ³n negativa (en torno a un 2 sobre 10), de hecho es la primera que hago en Steam â€¦ Tiene todo el aspecto de ser un juego hecho con prisas aprovechando el buen motor grÃ¡fico de ARMA y su reputaciÃ³n â€¦ sin conocer el gÃ©nero de la estrategia por turnos y lo que los jugadores del gÃ©nero demandamos en 2017 sobre ellos. Resumiendo, mi impresiÃ³n es que se ha querido â€œhacer cajaâ€ sacando de forma apresurada un juego de estrategia por turnos basado en ARMA.

Quitando los grÃ¡ficos  â€¦ No es ni siquiera comparable a juegos como XCOM. De hecho, estÃ¡, muy, muy, pero que muy por debajo del primer XCOM de Microprose â€¦ Â¡De los aÃ±os 90!

Espero que estos comentarios aporten visibilidad a los amantes de la estrategia por turnos y que se hayan planteado adquirir este juego.

Saludos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095543743', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1491446017}
review:
Arma Tactics is a game that I personally expected to be better simply because of it being an Arma game. I got all the Arma games together in a Humble Bundle and that ended up being the only reason that I ended up with this game. 

The game is full of bugs and is unenjoyable to play. The game seems poorly cobbled together, as if the people working on it didn't know that they were all making the same game together. The enemies seem to be able to see your soldiers through walls and even seem to be able to shoot through walls at times to hit your soldiers. When your soldiers first open fire, it seems as if every soldier on the map is suddenly aware of your location regardless of how far away they are. Cover is completely useless in the game because it never seems like your soldiers can really take cover from the enemy. 

The first mission of the game - following the tutorial - is literally impossible to complete simply because of how buggy the game is. I played long enough to try the first mission a few times and never bothered to play the game again after that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007549952', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1457314414}
review:
Arma Tactics is a turn-based close-combat strategy game, where the player takes control of a four-member Special Forces team. There are no given strategies, rails to move on, or paths to follow; itâ€˜s up to the player to decide how he will play through both the story-driven missions and generated missions with randomized objectives. Whether using stealth or a more direct approach, players will need to use their strategic thinking and use both basic and advanced weaponry while facing many different opponents - ranging from unorganized local militia to smart and skilled mercenaries.

It all sounds so good and with a quality brand like Armed Assault behind it you expect it to be of the same high standard. Unfortunately this is anything but... the game play is basic, the enemy AI is pitiful as is your own teams. Graphics are sub standard and this game basically reeks. Games of a similar vein wood be Jagged Alliance and X-Com and despite having older release dates than ARMA Tactics they are both so much better. This game lacks atmosphere. Do avoid it and don't get drawn into wasting your money on it like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1643037016}
review:
Tags: Tactical - Squad & Military
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Step down to the old classic tactical games in isometric or topdown form or step up to Xcom2 or something. This is lackluster. 

Bland, Military tactics setting on unity engine. Over the cam moments between movement and most of the audiovisual support is on the okay side of things. Except there are way too many reflections on everything cheapening the immersion, probably to try to wow the player with shinies. Not much of a plot hook or setting to get you interested. Gamepad support was interesting. Game is too simple with lack of combat stances, and limited interactivity. Level design was just a bunch of empty rooms with covers as well as open areas.

review:
Truly a horrible game. Literally nothing is worked out properly!
Bugged and boring music (partially ripped from Red Alert) total lack of IA, long waiting times from start to end, bugged camera views, retarded interface.... You name it, they messed it up!

You'll get no money if you fail a mission, using nades and healing costs you money so if you run out, you'll have a tough time completing any mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070962287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1498213564}
review: Bought it in the sale as I enjoyed XCOM and wanted a "real world" equivalent. Â£1.19 and it was still a waste of money: bugs that were noticed back in 2013 were still here and I was naive enough to think theyd been fixed. Voice acting is abysmal, almost paradying itself. At times its unplayable, as the game forgets to put soldiers in "downed" mode and out right kills them automatically failing the tutorial. I've been shot through walls, the AI stands in the open and then snipe your soldier in the best cover with a Makrov.  Utter disappointment, even 4 years ago this game would have been terrible and a waste of money.  As a fan of the Arma series, this game tarnishes its reputation and makes me ashamed to have even admit I spent real money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078244065', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1524766880}
review:
Ist vielleicht Geschmackssache und hat vom Gameplay nicht viel mit Arma zu tun, aber ich spiele es wirklich gern. Ich glaube, dass viele schlechte Reviews der Tatsache geschuldet sind, dass man sich wirklich erst einmal in das Spiel finden und es verstehen muss. Und natÃ¼rlich ist nicht alles Perfekt. Aber Leute das Spiel kostet 6.99 bzw. 1.39 im Sale. Und Bugs habe ich noch keine entdeckt, nur eine manchmal etwas ungÃ¼nstige Steuerung.
Ich finde es auch ehrlich gesagt etwas unangebracht an so ein Billigspiel die gleichen MaÃŸstÃ¤be, wie an einen Vollpreistitel anzulegen (was ja hier einige Reviewer machen). Vor 10 Jahren wÃ¤re dieses Spiel ein Vollpreistitel gewesen und heute macht es -wenn man bereit ist sich auf die Mechanik einzulassen und sich ein bisschen anzustrengen- wirklich SpaÃŸ.

Von mir gibt es -entgegen den ganzen Hatern- ein Daumen hoch und eine Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041532773', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1492296784}
review:
Non ci siamo!
Si puÃ² passare sopra alla grafica non eccezionale, al comparto sonoro praticamente inesistente, persino alla trama davvero ridicola e all'imprecisione dei comandi, purchÃ© almeno la parte strategica si salvi.
Invece anche quella fa schifo.
La maggiorparte delle volte conviene tirare fuori il naso un attimo e poi rintanarsi aspettando che tutta la sarabanda esca allo scoperto per venirvi a cercare e quindi con gli attacchi di interruzione sterminarli senza pietÃ .
Anche perchÃ© se non fate questo e vi smattite per andarli a cercare lo faranno loro e voi morirete, quindi lasciate perdere.
Il problema sorge quando nell'ultima missione della prima "campagna" (ma dai! Non chiamiamola cosÃ¬, Ã¨ composta da 5 sole misisoni...) misteriosamente non potrete utilizzare i silenziatori e tutti i terroristi africani sono dei cecchini dotati di fucili SVD Dragunov e sono abilissimi tiratori scelti che neanche Il Nemico Alle Porte... ma dai....
Il tutto per allungare il brodo, visto che non c'Ã¨ neanche un pezzo di carne allora ti costringiamo a mangiare 20 volte la stessa minestra finchÃ© non trovi il percorso migliore per uscirne sano e salvo... ANCHE NO GRAZIE.
L'ho preso in humble bundle ad 1 Euro ed Ã¨ quello che vale considerando che non l'ho neanche completato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093518342', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1457914235}
review: I have Arma Tactics on Steam and iOS. I really enjoy the game, however, if you're looking for something with typical Arma graphics and gameplay, this is definitely not it. If you're hoping for an overhead turn-based game, this is exactly it, and it functions quite well with decent graphics and effects to go with it. Arma 3 players may be disappointed though. I happen to enjoy turn based games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971010557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1489240512}
review:
Resumen: Juego sencillo con combate tactico tipo X-COM, con apenas capa estrategica pero al menos una historia. EstarÃ­a bien para pasar el rato, pero la plaga de bugs y cuelgues (de los que te amargan la vida) lo hacen imposible. Recomiendo probar una demo antes de comprar para ver que tal funciona con vuestro sistema, o al menos esperar a las rebajas.

Detalles:
Juego tactico de infanteria moderna por turnos con toques de rol estilo X-COM, Breach & Clear, etc.
Compras equipo y ganas experiencia para mejorar a los miembros de la unidad, aunque todo se antoja muy superficial.
No hay una capa estratÃ©gica de juego como en X-COM, pero al menos sÃ­ hay una historia y objetivos de misiÃ³n que enlazan una campaÃ±a (a diferencia de Breach & Clear por ejemplo).
El combate tÃ¡ctico es sencillo, muy similar al de los nuevos X-COM, pero da posibilidades suficientes.
Graficamente estÃ¡ bien y no tiene altos requerimientos tÃ©cnicos (va muy bien en portatiles con algunas tarjetas integradas Intel HD por ejemplo).
El problema: Bugs, crashes, freezes, etc... desde el mismo tutorial que no estÃ¡ muy bien scripteado. No le pasa a todo el mundo, pero si a muchos. EstÃ¡ pidiendo a gritos un parche en condiciones, pero ya hace 4 aÃ±os que saliÃ³ y aÃºn estÃ¡ asÃ­.
Si quereis un juegazo de este estilo, tendreis que mirar en otra parte (X-COM y sus infinitos clones). Si quereis un juego mÃ¡s casual y de bajo precio recomiendo probar Breah & Clear -este casi solo tiene parte tactica ojo-.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055109077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1498500736}
review:
If you manage to get past the beginning, forgive its flaws, and get used to it, it is an enjoyable  little game. Not too serious, perfect for a quick break, as most missions can be finished in ~30 minutes.

Just make sure you get it on sale, it is not worth the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983888792', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1487367255}
review:
The game is awesome. A turn based "shooter", with the option to change loadouts and upgrade equipment.
The only issue is do have with it is that while behind "cover" you should not be able to be shot, when in fact you can be. This kinda defeats the point of being behind cover.
Its annoying but is something you can live with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077445344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1485658136}
review:
The game is poorly designed, where taking cover makes no difference on your defense, health system is faulty, missions don't make much sense (where you are asked to go stealthy, but it is virtually impossible to do so) and I won't even get to the bug area.
It is playable, but there are some deep design flaws on it that really make this game unworthy playing. (you won't be missing anything)
Edit: I just finished the game and it's worse than i had foreseen, the last mission is absolutely ridiculous. Save yourself some money and time and don't buy it. Don't even accept if it's for free.

review:
like so many other "tactics" games you are given two action points and movement consumes action points. i disagree with that system. 

nothing in this game stood out to me. the graphics and gameplay were lackluster. been a while since i actually played this so i cannot remember specifics, but i know i did not like it enough to keep it installed on my machine.

i do not recommend this game. there are better tactics games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967101102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1482292842}
review: I cannot in good conscience recommend this game.  The controls are buggy, the tutorial doesn't explain it very good.  I did not have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134668996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1481344385}
review:
This game is the most broken turn-based "tactical" shooter I've seen.  Cover means nothing (you will be shot through it), line of sight means nothing (you will be shot when not in it), range means nothing (you will be shot from miles away while behind cover and out of line of sight), grenade arcs mean nothing (it will bounce off of objects on its way to the destination and then detonate to damage anything within about 6 inches)... you get the picture.  The tutorial gets you all set up for something... and then throws you into the first mission against about a dozen enemies where you have no choice but to engage them in a bottleneck.  Tactically, this sound viable right?  Consider the previous issues and you'll relaize it's an exercise in frustration.

It has nothing to do with learning the mechanics.  The mechanics are broken.  There is almost no chance for tactics.  What you end up doing is trying to trick the AI into bumrushing you where you can defend yourself.  Hopefully... but even then you have 3 men against a dozen.  You get overwhlmed.  If anyone dies at any time, it's over.

Listen, I'm stubborn.  I gave this game a shot several times.  I have major problems getting past the first mission.  Most people do.  It's that bad, and it never gets better.  Avoid this game.  Do not even buy it on sale for a dollar; it's not worth the aggrivation and the devs shouldn't be rewarded in any way for this garbage.
Love tactical games like this?  Try Breach & Clear... for a cheap title, at least that game works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048605829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1481306865}
review:
gioco un po cosÃ¬ cosÃ¬, non Ã¨ brutto, ma ha un po di difetti che non lo rendono perfetto, e vado a spiegare i motivi.
allora sinceramente sono un po indeciso se consigliare o meno questo titolo, a me personalmente Ã¨ piaciuto, e forse per gli amanti dei giochi tattici a turni, puÃ² essere un bel gioco.

PRO:
1) le missioni non sono tanto semplici, quindi questo allunga la longevitÃ , se ti muore anche solo un componente del team, hai fallito e devi riniziare da capo, quindi devi stare molto attento alle mosse che fai
2) Ã¨ un gioco leggero che gira praticamente ovunque
3) ci sono diverse armi che si possono acquistare (fucile d'assalto, mitragliatrice leggera, fucile a pompa, fucile da cecchino, queste armi possono anche essere potenziate acquistando vari accessori come il silenziatore, il caricatore aumentato, un mirino aggiuntivo e altre cose, poi ci sono svariate granate di diverso tipo (granate, fumogene, flashbang, claymore), ed infine i medikit per curarti durante la partita (essenziali visto che come ho detto come muore un membro hai fallito la missione e devi riniziare da capo, indipendentemente da dove eri arrivato)

CONTRO:
le pecche non mancano
1) ogni tanto capita qualche bug
2) durante il turno del nemico non puoi fare assolutamente niente, puoi solo regolare lo zoom e ruotare la visuale, ma non puoi spostare la visuale per vedere diverse zone della mappa, quindi devi rimanere in attesa senza poter fare niente (e non si puÃ² neanche accelerare il tempo per accorciare il turno nemico)
3) non si puÃ² salvare durante una partita, quindi se per caso arrivi quasi alla fine della missione e fai una mossa sbagliata facendo morire un tuo membro del team, devi ricaricare il gioco dall'inizio della missione (il salvataggio automatico c'Ã¨, ma non Ã¨ possibile ricaricare durante la missione, ma puoi ricaricare solo quando per esempio chiudi il gioco e lo riapri, ti riparte da dove eri rimasto
4) se durante il turno del nemico, ti uccidono un soldato, non ti da immediatamente la missione fallita, ma i nemici continuano tutti a eseguire le loro mosse perdendo tempo inutilmente perchÃ¨ tanto appena Ã¨ il tuo turno, questo morirÃ  senza che tu puoi fare niente, potevano almeno darti il game over immediato.

detto questo alla fine il gioco lo consiglio per chi Ã¨ amante del genere, non Ã¨ certo un capolavoro, purtroppo soffre molto il fatto che sia un porting della versione mobile, ma preso in sconto non Ã¨ neanche cosÃ¬ tanto male, di certo saprÃ  farti divertire per diverse ore, e comunque Ã¨ un tipo di gioco non troppo impegnativo, nel senso che puoi giocartelo comodamente anche dal divano col portatile per fare un missione e poi chiuderlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048417808', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1465439517}
review:
In this game you command a spec-ops team on a hilarious mission to take down a menacing group of super soldiers with X-ray vision, hearing that would put your best Doberman Pinscher to shame and smart bullets capable of hitting you from off the map, around corners, thru multiple walls and while crouched behind elevated cover. Apparently, these super soldiers are also expert computer hackers. So good, in fact, that they can actually hack into your game and delete your save files. Really crafty â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥s, these super soldiers.

Hands down, one of the most broken games on Steam. BI's willingness to sell you this garbage is a pretty good indication of their integrity. Things might be different if there was a note from the developer on the store page that said something like "Hey guys, this is a PC port of a mobile game and it's really, really broken. We don't have any plans to actually fix it, as you can see, but watching some of the stupid â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ that happens in this game is still pretty good for a laugh so we think $0.50 is fair."

LMAO! 

No!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083283630', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1565987037}
review: Pues a mÃ­ si me gusta, Â¿se puede mejorar? SÃ­, pero me entretiene mucho y eso es lo que me interesa. Lo ideal es que hicieran un XCOM pero de esta tematica, no tan futurista. A mÃ­ es que eso de los extraterrestres y tanta tecnologia y tantoas armas laser y plasma, en fin, que no me gusta. Pero ya digo que si los creadores de XCOM 2 lo hacen igual de bien pero con la tematica de Arma Tactics, serÃ­a flipante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043642585', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1476054303}
review: While I am not really a fan of this MilSim genre, I had hoped that ARMA Tactics would be something of a mondern Full Spectrum Warrior; which if you haven't played I would highly recommend checking it out. Now I haven't played for very long, so take that in mind; I basically completed the tutorial and watched the first cutscene. Right off the bat the gameplay feels clunky, with an interface not designed with a gamer in mind; having to click on my character to reload seems a bit silly, but not the end of the world I suppose. However the graphics are lacking a bit, though I've reccently come to learn that this was apparently a port, and some terrible voice acting to boot. While not bad things in a mobile game, it does nothing to propell this game into anything successful; instead its relying on its name to get what I would assume was most people who played this game to buy it. I wouldn't mind having played this first on a tablet, where something this game would truly shine, however with XCOM, another turn based squad tactics game, you would be better of playing that, or perhaps something like Breach and Clear. So for a first impression of the game, I would steer clear, and do some more in depth research to see if perhaps this game would be for you. For fans of the genre, you likely won't find anything new, and I would only suggest buying this if you can pick it up for relatively cheap, or you've exhausted all other options, and you've modded XCom 2 to the point of crashing and corrupting all your files.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028818880', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1474121813}
review:
Po par hodinach som definitivne zabalil svoje snazenie v napaditej tahovke od Bohemie na motivy Army. Chcel som dat tomuto netradicnemu pokusu sancu, ale znudenie a znechutenie nakoniec zvitazilo. Na pomery tahovych strategii ide viac-menej o budgetovu formu spracovania a urcite sa najdu u konkurencie zaujimavejsie kusky. Nicmenej nenarocneho hraca, ktory uz nema v tahovych strategiach do coho pichnut by takticka Arma urcite oslovit mohla.

Grafika je tu ale podpriemerna, prostredie fadne, dizajn urovni nezaujimavy a takticke moznosti tak nejak "netakticke". Priznam sa, ze som uplne nepochopil o co tej hre vlastne ide. Rozostavil som svojich hrdinnych vojacikov do krytu, aby boli chraneny pred nepriatelskou strelbou. TÃ­ vsak veselo do mojich v kryte zasytych hrdinov palili a odoberali im cenne bodiky zivotnej sily. Ak bol v kryte protivnik, tak sanca na zasah mojich chlapcov sa rovnala nule a tak vzdy "minuli". Tiez som bol do dnesneho dna presvedceny o tom, ze 100% sanca na nieco zamena jasny uspech. Tu 100% sanca zasahu ale nutne neznamena, ze vas vojak neminie ciel.

Trochu ma to mrzi, pretoze zo zaciatku sa mi Arma Tactics celkom pozdavala. Ma jednoduche a zrozumitelne ovladanie, moznost menit a vylepsovat vybavu, ktora vas nezahlti stovkami bezcennych poloziek a pre mna aj zvolene prostredie. Spracovanie je ale slabsie a s vyskytom urcitych chyb, co je vlastne pre seriu Arma uz neodmyslitelnou sucastou. K Arma Tactics som sa dostal cez bundle od Bohemia Interactive, cize takmer zadarmo a ako som pisal v uvode, verim, ze niekoho tato budgetova zalezitost zabavit dokaze, ale mna si teda neziskala.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070677644', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1459169167}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015280018', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1475272418}
review: Fun little stragety game that actually has a pretty steep learning curve. Once you get the hang of how to move as an effective squad you should love the game if you're a fan of Tactics style play (FF Tactics, etc.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970198529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1739, 'last_played': 1469704831}
review:
It's not perfect but I do really enjoy it. I think it is worth it at full price but if you can get it on sale and if you like these sorts of games (top-down / isometric squad turn-based strategy games) there certainly aren't enough bugs or gameplay issues that they should keep you from adding it to your library. Just don't expect anything on the same level as the full FPS ARMA games. 
Also in it's favor is the fact that Bohemia still seems to be supporting it with occasional engine updates and bug fixes.
I only wish that the saves between the mobile and PC versions would sync. (If your listening Bohemia: Please!? That would be so incredible! Or at least info on a way to do it manually!)

review:
Pour tout ce qui suis, commencer chaque phrase par "Pour ce prix lÃ "

Bon jeu de combat tactique au tour par tour.

En rÃ©sumÃ© : Gameplay acceptable, sons et graphismes assez bon.

Pour le dÃ©tail :

Le gameplay est simple Ã  prendre en main et l'interface est claire, Ã§a n'a l'air de rien mais pour ce type de jeu c'est trÃ¨s important. Chaque soldat de l'escouade Ã  plus ou moins une spÃ©cialitÃ© et peu Ãªtre amÃ©liorÃ© en prenant de l'expÃ©rience et en achetant de l'Ã©quipement. Ne vous attendez toutefois pas Ã  dÃ©bloquer de nouvelles capacitÃ© avec l'expÃ©rience, vous pouvez juste amÃ©liorer celles de base (y compris celles qui sont Ã  0 ceci dit). Ce jeu se voulant assez rÃ©aliste, c'est un choix logique.

Rien de particulier Ã  dire niveau sons et graphismes, c'est tout Ã  regardable et entendable.

Un mot sur le scÃ©nario : il existe. Il n'est pas transcendant, mais il ne part pas en vrille non plus. Juste ce qu'on peut attendre d'un jeu qui fait dans le rÃ©alisme.

Evidemment petite prÃ©cision pour ceux qui n'aurait pas compris, on fait ici lÃ©gÃ¨rement dans le jeu de propagande pour l'US Army, mais Ã§a ne l'empÃªche pas d'Ãªtre un jeu trÃ¨s correct voir plus pour son prix (6.99 euros au moment oÃ¹ j'Ã©cris ces lignes).

Pour les amateurs du genre :
Ce jeu est assez dificile, spÃ©cialement les derniÃ¨res missions. Par contre, niveau gameplay il ne faut pas s'attendre Ã  des miracles. C'est le premier de ce type que j'ai essayÃ©, c'est lui qui m'a fait apprÃ©cier le genre mais quand j'ai essayÃ© d'y rejouer aprÃ¨s XCOM, j'ai dit non pas possible.

En conclusion, si vous aimez les combats tactiques au tour par tour, il est bien et jouable mais dur. Si vous ne connaissez pas ce type de jeu, vous pouvez l'acheter pour tester le genre plutÃ´t que de prendre un risque avec mieux mais en payant nettement plus cher (en gardant Ã  l'esprit qu'il est tout mÃªme assez difficile).

author: {'steamid': '76561198054477457', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1384, 'last_played': 1473726104}
review:
I really wanted to recommend this game, and be a positive review in all the bashing but I just can't, this is a turn based tactical strategy game but you can never count on tactical play, it's only luck. Enemies will spot you from ridiculous spots like from behind three walls or they will spot you coming from behind even if they are looking the other way, and sometimes you will run in front of them and they won't spot you, but other than that I liked the graphics, the animations the sounds, the equipments and the leveling system, the whole gameplay idea is not bad even though in close places sometimes you miss click an action because of bad ports.
The story is basically two operations for a total of 10 missions, you can as well play free missions to level up your operators, your shooting is affected by distance and the skill of the operator on this particular gun but what's the point if the main purpose of the game, the 'tactical strategy' part is broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045913515', 'num_games_owned': 1802, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1464571290}
review: The day I played Arma Tactics for the first time was also the day I played it the last time. Do not be deceived by the low price tag or Arma brand slapped on this game, it is complete and utter garbage. The game is so frustratingly broken that I couldn't even be bothered to try and finish the first level after very few attempts. The moment one enemy notices you the rest come rushing in on your squad and you're pretty much screwed, and don't even bother taking cover because enemies can shoot your soldiers through concrete walls and any other forms of "cover" without even trying. I wanted to train my soldiers in hopes of maybe bettering my chances, but sadly the "randomized" missions that I was told about in one of the tooltips are only available if you complete the campaign missions. Arma fan, tactical strategy fan or otherwise, stay far away from this game.

review: Look, it's a cheap, simple game similar to the recent Xcom game on a lower scale (and budget) it has zero to do with arma, and even as someone with hundreds of hours in each traditional arma game, i can still say that this game is a fun romp for a while. just dont expect the realism of an arma game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041100695', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1630430761}
review:
Negatives:

-Gameplay
>A dull and short story line, the game consists of two campaigns with five missions each. Each mission is pretty short, uninteresting and won't last you longer than 15 minuites tops
>Mechanicals are quite dull and can get boring pretty fast

-AI 
>Clunky AI detection, when trying to be stealthy especially when trying to get the Silent Threat achievement the AI can detect you from a wide range of questionability, from the understandable range to the outrageous
>No challenging AI, once a guy knows your there, the rest will usually come swarming until their all dead

-Technicals
>Sounds and Audio, with a background music that keeps looping it can get pretty dull.
>Voice acting is no different, its pretty bad, from conversations between soliders to callouts

Poitives??

-Technicals
>Normally from your turn-based strategy games you move units in tiles spaces (i.e XCOM Enemy Unknown and Metal Gear Acid), ARMA Tactics does is movement based on distance like in the old XCOMs
>Soldier Upgrades, as you complete missions you gain XP which can be used to improve a certain category in a solider

Verdict:

If a title such as ARMA is quite extensive with their mechanics and gameplay, why is this very cut down?
I give them 1.5/5 Stars (Its bad)

PS: I've been stuck on the Silent Threat Achivement for ages and its driving me crazy

review:
There are many better tactics games out there I wouldnt waste your time.

Being a huge fan of other tactics games and a huge fan of the Arma series I thought great! but I was wrong. Its soooooo slow to play and the maps are pretty tedious.

There is a small RPG element to it, as in pick your gear and level up your troops but the game becomes exremely repetitive.

Short review as there is nothing really to say. Spend your money on something else.

review: This a mobile port of a pseudo-game with impossibly effortless game mechanics, useless camera, infuriating gameplay and demented voice acting completely lacking in talent or even tone. The graphics are so awful that I almost broke down after realising that outside of a humble bundle, you can buy this game for Â£5.99. You can buy so much for Â£5.99, including paper clips, and those would be more fun (and practical) than this useless game. This was clearly tested by a team of monkeys, because the piss-poor nature of this game could not possibly come as a result of human error unless those humans were constantly hemorrhaging out of their brains...

author: {'steamid': '76561197962973671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1452500326}
review: Apparently Bohemia has hit rock bottom with this one. Cant really say anything good, based on my 1 hour of annoying gameplay. Graphics: Cant touch this! No seriously there arent any Craphics options, and the game looks like it came from a tablet. Sounds: Counted about 3-4 different weapon sounds + 1 explosion. Think thats about it. Gameplay: Sluggish, dull, takes forever, dont know what counts as cover, camera angles? O_O Basic Arma ai, they dont know of your existence if you are on theyre backside, and sometimes they can see the grain of sand in your eyesocket. I really hope they arent wasting time on this one anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1452456139}
review:
Arma Tactics Ã© um dos piores jogos deste gÃªnero que jÃ¡ experimentei, parece que usam o nome famoso pra vender um jogo mediano. Encontrei alguns bugs, mas o pior Ã© o prÃ³prio jogo: campanha sem graÃ§a, fases monÃ³tonas, interface feia e confusa e por fim, varias mecÃ¢nicas confusas e arbitrarias. Recomendo que vocÃª tente Breach & Clear invÃ©s de pegar esse jogo.
----------------------------------
Arma Tactics is one of the worst games of this genre I've ever experienced, it seems that use the famous name to sell an average game. I found some bugs, but the worst is the game itself: dull campaign, monotonous levels, ugly and confusing interface and finally, several confusing and arbitrary mechanical. I recommend you try Breach & Clear instead of taking this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025403939', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1433345218}
review:
A rather decent game with turn based gameplay, somewhat similar to that of X-Com. The controls are good, it's interesting to try out the different weapons in various situations, but the story isn't nearly as entertaining and you'd get bored after a while.

I'd rate it 5 wounded soldiers out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087364090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1451955430}
review:
I received this game as part of a bundle, so it isn't a big deal that it's atrocious. I wanted to like this game so much since I'm a fan of the Arma series and I'm a massive fan of Breach & Clear (over 150 hours); alas this game is horrible. I played for about 1.5 hours and I couldn't even complete any of the first missions because my guys would freeze mid-run and I would have to Alt+F4 just to get back into the game. 

Considering this game is two years old you'd think they'd have something like that fixed by now, but judging by the comments they pretty much gave up on this game a long time ago. 

I wouldn't waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140876847', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1534364263}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077245539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1451429077}
review:
It starts with funny rag-doll-glitches, broken Steam-Awards, etc.pp.
Obvious bugs all over the game (since years!).

Also - it feels way too simple (and boring) for such a complex topic.
The controls are glitchy (for best result: rather drag&drop than double-click).
Graphics are .... cheap?!
(And cheap graphics are okay, as long as they are functional. But in this game, it feels like the engine tries to hinder you actively.)

Nuff said.
So: no, no, no. Thanks, but NO!!!!

Breach and Clear does it better, Door Kickers feels better, but back in the days I would prefer Jagged Alliance and XCom.
Actually, almost *any* turn-based tactical game does a better job than this one.



PS: I have no idea how "Arma" made its way into the title.
Game-wise this is not related to the classical ARMA in any way.
PPS: The action-cam was actually something I liked, but soon this gets boring  too.

review: ĞŸĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063426694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1613571082}
review:
This game unlike other ARMA games is totaly not worth of playing / buying.
Game is full of bugs, and graphics are bad and there's still lot of work to do on this game.

- Campaings are short and they really don't make any sense
- Graphics are bad
- Soldiers can get stuck for some reason and you can't do anything else but to restart whole game
- In game it says "Saving"... i wonder where it saves checkpoints cuz you can only restart whole mission and play it from beginning
- Accuracy is badly coded i guess.... it says 90% of killing enemy and it totaly misses the target
- When it's your turn to move soldiers, enemies can still move if they detect you, BUT if you detect enemies you don't have chance to move your soldiers
- In most cases when enemy detects you they will automaticaly fire on you, and they will hit you even through the wall, BUT if your soldiers detect enemies, they rarely shoot at them automaticaly, which is a total blow
- Achievements are badly coded... mines in game are being recognized as grenades for some reason, and when you want to kill 2 or more enemies with one greande, you can't even do that, cuz grenade DEALS only up to 50% of damage, and radius is small, and when you actualy manage to do that, it doesn't even count as achievement
- Silencers in this game are non-existent, which means you can't even have them, even tho you bought them and applied them.
- Enemies can see you sometimes when they have their backs turned on you (i guess some of enemies have eyes on their backs)
- Developers obviously never heard of casualties of war, cuz if one of your teammates dies missions will automaticaly fail... 


ONLY TWO SHORT CAMPAIGNS, BAD STORY, BAD VOICE ACTING, POORLY MADE... NOT WORTH OF 7â‚¬, NOT WORTH OF ANY MONEY UNTIL IT'S FIXED!
