author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1446620735}
review:
The turn-based tactical game about a squad of 4 shooters, engaging in some minor conflicts across the world. It wears an "Arma" name, for it was made by the same Bohemia studio, which shipped the whole "Arma" games series. As it turns out, in the end, it becomes something like an unwanted child, which is not deserving to be left behind but appears as a burden to its creators and developers...

I was very surprised when finding that game already in my library while I was searching through Steam for something like "Jagged Alliance". I can swear I neither heard about that game before nor that I planned to buy it. I guess it was one of those bundles, where I was totally distracted by one desired game, and others were bought "just because". Anyway, the Steam search machine finally highlighted me that addition in my collection, and I decided to investigate.

So I've read the info about the game. Majority of the reviews up to this date are negative, but named reasons wasn't enough for me. I decided to give it a shot... Well, now I can say I wasn't enjoyed playing this game myself.

What is good about it? First, it looks like modern XCOM Enemy Unknown for many aspects of gameplay, which makes a process of understanding the gameâ€™s basics a really brief job. In other words, youâ€™ll get by very quickly after the start. Second, it is a very fine use of the Unity engine. The game really looks great, especially when compared to the representatives of the same class, turn-based squad tactical games. And when we are talking about mobile platforms with Tegra technology. But that praise concerns ONLY visual decals part, not the thorough in-game mechanics. For those people of Bohemia really should take some classes before selling to PC players something with that lack of deepness.

I feel Iâ€™m spending too much time on this project, so, letâ€™s be brief from now on:

-	Easy to adopt â€“ considering how little content there is, once you complete one or two missions, youâ€™ll basically see everything that game has. Even if you want a complete, with all achievements in your pocket, it could be done in less than 10 hours, depending on your skill.

-	It is a 3d game, with quite good visuals â€“ and the fact that almost all of the best squad tactics games are from previous isometric eraâ€¦ well, as previous, it is not a â€œProâ€ point, as those visuals are good only for mobile standards for modern games. At PC they are just tolerable.

-	As we are remembering old games of this genre, like Jagged Alliance or Silent Storm, they are so much cooler in every aspect, so much deeper in every given pixel, and so much more capable to capture your time, that I really donâ€™t want to go further with comparisons.

-	As of tactical component of Arma Tactics, well, it is quite dim â€“ and all because of non-competing AI. And if we are speaking of realism thereâ€¦ there are very little types (and models) of weapons in the game, and all of them are so short-sighted, that even sentry fellas armed only with sniper rifles â€“ or they will be missing every shot in more than 10 meters! Yeah, guards patrolling with SVD, so natural as life will never be.

-	Finally, the bugs section. Steam community is full of complaints about something not working properly, but Iâ€™ve played the game after two years after its PC release and was able to make through all game missions without major problems. Well, before the very last one, Damned Dam. There I killed everybody, lined my toy soldiers after the truck, into the exit zoneâ€¦ and nothing! And then I discovered that there are two builds in the game, and I was able to finally finish the game only with â€œbetaâ€ build because on the major build final cutscene was lost somewhereâ€¦ Epic fails for Bohemia, though not the first and not the last one, obviously. From other, not so significant issues, I can call unfitted control, where I need to click many times to finally make something happen â€“ like walking close to some object, would that be an enemy or just a crate with pocket money. Irritating, but manageable.

Conclusion: while the game is not a total mess, it is worth any interest only on mobile devices. PC port appeared buggy and totally not on the level with the PC games of the same genre. Gold with achievements is attainable, yet I would not be proud of that badge. My mark is 4.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052086178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1445043511}
review:
[h1]Un ottimo gioco tattico a turni, al contrario di quello che molti dicono. 7,5/10[/h1]
Devo dire che davo per scontato quanto potesse impegnare e divertire questo titolo, e al contrario di quello che dicono tantissimi utenti per me questo gioco, essendo inoltre fatto con unity3D non Ã¨ per niente male.

Arma Tactics ci da la possibilitÃ  di gestire l'equippagiamento dei soldati (4) che possiamo usare in battaglia, possiamo quindi scegliere a chi dare armi di tipo diverso e a chi dare granate, kit medici, claymore e altri accessori; In battaglia gli spostamenti dei personaggi e la gestione della copertura di essi Ã¨ molto intuitiva ed'Ã¨ anche facile gestire gli accessori da utilizzare, sono presenti 10 livelli che formano due campagne davvero impegnativi ed'Ã¨ possibile crearne altri (non ho visto la parte dell'editor).
E' possibile sbloccare nuove armi e accessori tramite dei crediti ottenuti giocando.

Consiglio quindi Arma Tactics a chi volesse divertirsi con un ottimo gioco di guerra tattico a turni, dove Ã¨ possibile gestire 4 personaggi e scegliere il piano per portarsi avanti in battaglia, Ã¨ anche un gioco che richiede una buona abilitÃ  nel capire come usare a proprio vantaggio gli oggetti e i muri dello scenario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103090723', 'num_games_owned': 3002, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1442565180}
review:
Pro:
ARMA universe
X-com esk set-up
Steam cards
Controller support
Turn based tactical
Devs seem to still be working on the game
Demo
Several (7) languages
Low system specs


Con:
Bad port
Subpar story
Questionable UI
Subpar camera work
Overpriced $9.99 CDN

Overall:
5/10 +1 cards, +1 turn based tactial, +2 demo, -1 UI, -1 price = 7/10

I'm not sure why this is so badly rated.  It's not that bad of a game (36% thumbs up). Does it need work? F ya.  Is the core good? yep. If your expecting Arma fps then this is not what you want.  If you want a X-com esk game in the Arma style then give the demo a try.  If you like the demo, pick up the game when it's on sale for under $3.

This game is pretty much Furmark the Video Game. Despite the low requirements it renders as many frames as possible at any given time.

You will need to find a way to force V-Sync on (on your graphics card management software) or face the real possibility of a reduced GPU  lifespan as a result of playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054667001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1439584197}
review:
I got this game when I was able to throw away a few dollars on gambling with games. At the time, it was on sale, 50%-off or so. About $4 or thereabouts. I figured it'd be a nice little addition to my collection of tactical games, and the reviews that were showing were mostly positive, despite the overall rating. Finally got around to playing it and it locked up on me, gave no clear instructions, and defaulted to trying to use my gamepad AND the clunky mouse controls at the SAME TIME. 

I'm not sure how long I spent, but I was sorely disappointed almost right away. Didn't even finish the tutorial because it locked up an animation and simply sat there. I closed down, checked this page to see what others experienced, and hung my head in shame.

I wish I had my $4 back.

review:
- Enemies shooting through walls (cover is a joke), while I got constant "unit is not in line of sight" when they are right next to my character,

- Idiot teammates, 
- B-movie script and characters, 
- Camera never staying where you need it to be....

Yeah. It's a mess. Stear Clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061740176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1438881039}
review:
I got this game because I am a huge fan of the ArmA series and I expected another work of art from Bohemia with this game. If you're expecting Something comparable to ArmA 2 or 3, run now. There's nothing for you here. But since it's a Bohemia game, I'll try to be gentle, but of course, no promises for a sh

-The story is mediocre. Lets go kill a terrorist. Yay. Modern warfare sterotypical bullshit. No effort was put into it.
-The voice acting is terrible for the most part with the exception of one character whose voice nostalgically brings me back to ArmA 2.
+An interesting customization system where you can equip your characters with different guns, upgrade those guns, and equip different grenade types to help you as well along with medpacks, morphine, and claymores. HOWEVER...
-There is little to nothing to customize your characters with. 3 useless grenade types, Claymores that you'll never get to use, and  4 gun types that are essentially useless since you can dominate the entire game with the base weapons the game gives you without a single upgrade.
-The camera angle is terrible. Trying to command units under roofs is insanely frustrating. 
-Graphical glitches galore. You shoot and enemy and he flies into the air, his body transforming into rubber in the midst of a seizure, only to implode into his hat in mid-air, and stay there...staring at you for the rest of the game. 
-The sounds are medicore, and the soundtrack is repetitive, and occasionally doesn't even play.
-The controls are so bad it actually had me screaming at the game. Clearly designed for a touch-screen smartphone or tablet, playing this game with a mouse and keyboard will have you throwing your mouse at the wall. 
-The blandest, least in-depth characters I have ever seen.
-Too short. And the random mission generator doesn't help unless you really like tedious, boring, glitchy gameplay.
-Stealth-based portions of mission that you can instantly fail for no discernable reason considering there are no indicators to help you with stealth.
-Unclear mission objectives that will have you scratching your head for a good long time on how to complete them, when you are literally staring at the objective trying to complete it.

3/10. A good game to get your friend on april fools day, or your enemies for christmas. I'm sure masochists would love playing this game. I regret that a dollar was ever spent to get me this game from a bundle. Stay. Away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1439249599}
review: Arma Tactics was ported from the smartphone for the PC in 2013. It differs from other Arma titles by being a point and click, turn-based game. You control up to 4 members of a squad who you use to overcome a variety of objectives. Each member has different abilities. Characters can purchase upgrades and level up based on experience points. In all it isn't a bad port, unlike Deus Ex: The Fall which was horrible. Arma Tactics is different but interesting and when played on a smartphone probably is a pretty decent game. As a PC game, it strays so far from the Arma format, the name and the military theme are about all it has in common with the rest of the series. If you are a fan of the Arma series, you might not like Arma Tactics; However, if you enjoy turn-based tactical games, it is probably right up your alley. As a game it is decent and deserves a thumbs up, even if it isn't a game I would personally choose to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006446341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1436980429}
review:
Terrible interface, arbitrary mechanics, glitchy engine, dull art design, 2005 era graphics, and a boring campaign.  Yep, it's another a bad port of a bad tablet game.  Just forget this one ever happened.

If you really want this kind of game, Breach and Clear did it decently.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996694804', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1436762490}
review: I'm not sure why this game has such bad ratings. Sure, XCOM: Enemy Unknown is much better, but this game is far from a bad game. While you probably won't get as much out of this game as XCOM, if you're looking for another XCOM like strategy game, you might want to give this a try when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007539832', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1435860947}
review:
Juego por turnos donde llevas a unos special ops en varias misiones. Como todo juego de estrategia en 3 persona tienes una perspectiva del mapa, pero tienes el gran problema que no puedes "ver" dentro de un edificio, con lo cual es difÃ­cil colocar tus unidades en el interior (por no decir que entren). Otro problema son las acciones secundarias, como abrir cajas, o apuÃ±alar a un enemigo, son difÃ­ciles de conseguir pese estar al lado, cosa que es muy frustrante y me ha hecho decidir dejarlo a parte.

Por lo demÃ¡s tiene una cierta dificultad en saber-se administrar los recursos, unidades, etc. que le da un buen gusto de boca. Las cinematogrÃ¡ficas estÃ¡n bien pese tener unos aÃ±os y parece que la historia estÃ¡ bien elaborada, pero no puedo decir mucho ya que he jugado poco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041603555', 'num_games_owned': 1621, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 1846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1435730786}
review:
Arma Tactics was a mobile game backported to PC, and somehow it is extremely buggy with rage-quit worthy frustrations despite a decent tactical game under the whole thing. it cannot be recommended until the bugs are fixed. 

Arma Tactics is a turn-based tactical combat game where you command your fireteam of soldiers in combat against terrorists and guerillas and mercenaries in some generic African country full of slums and such. There are two campaigns (each of which are composed of 5 distinct missions, albeit linked) and once you've played through the mission once, it becomes available as a quick battle. 

The actual tactical battle happens on a full 3D battlefield, with multiple levels of elevation (i.e. you can walk to the roof / upper floor, and in case of bridges or dams, 3 levels of height difference). The buildings can often be walked into with alternate exits, and alternate paths are almost always present, so flanking, when possible, is highly recommended. 

Your soldiers automatically goes into cover when you send up leaning up against columns, door ledges, K-rails, basically anything that may shield them from bullets. They will still get hit, but will take less damage if they do get hit. However, the drag to move interface means you have to wiggle slightly to get the soldier to lean up against the cover properly, and sometimes, they will simply face the wrong way, and there's nothing you can do about it. 

Each soldier gets two action points per turn, and moving 5 meters is considered an action, as well as actions like throw grenade, reload, shoot, and so on. Shooting has an additional option, use 1 action for quick shot, or use both actions for aimed shot and higher accuracy. 

After each mission you can purchase skill points with your accumulated XPs, and if you have credits, you can buy upgrades for your weapons as well as additional weapons such as sniper rifle, combat shotgun, as well as more exotic weapons like remote controlled Claymore mine and regular Claymore trip mine, plus other equipment. Furthermore, credits can also be used to buy upgrades for the weapons, which improves them to all users of that weapon type. And you earn about 500+ credits and about 150 XP if you win a mission.  

As the namesake suggests, your need to employ proper infantry tactics such as move and fire, overwatch, proper use of cover, stealth vs. loud, and so on. The problem is there are many different bugs in the game that prevents a full enjoyment. 

Ragdoll physics are often hilarious as a kill would often find the body started shaking and dancing all over the place, probalby due to some polygonal collision issues, which in turn leads to even more hilariosu results, such as a dead body fying 25 ft into the air and 25 feet sideways, or a wounded soldier managed to shoot me withOUT a rifle (the rifle fell off after that shaking and dancing after a knife hit) 

Mechanics of attaching / detaching silencer was never properly explained, or that you automatically get silencer if you complete the first campaign. 

Another point of hilarity is how the smoke from a smoke-grenade is solid enough to bounce off other grenades. I wanted to throw a grenade through the smoke to land at enemy's feet, but my grenade bounced off the smoke... twice. On the other hand, at other times, it won't bounce. A throw that should have bounced off the door instead went THROUGH the door instead, wasting the grenade. 

These are relatively minor problems though, because there are big ones, such as how the game refused to end a mission even when one guy is standing on top of the exit zone, and thus causing me to lose that mission. 

The interface also coudl use a bit of help as it's clearly NOT optimized for mouse, and how various things are hidden under lays of menu and clicks. and such. 

Camera is movable but hard to control when you got to the "edges" of the playable level. 

Sound is rather lame, and voice acting is quite bad. Graphics are quite good 

All in all, while there seems to be a good game under all these bugs, in its present form it can't be recommended when there are games like XCOM  that does the tactical combat much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989374217', 'num_games_owned': 11271, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1435040265}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973786715', 'num_games_owned': 1942, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1435021376}
review:
I have nearly 500 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. 

One Hour Reviews - Game 12
Arma Tactics
Purchase Date: 1/16/2014

I picked up Arma Tactics as part of a Humble Bundle with the first 2 Arma games.  I started with Arma - Gold Edition first, then moved to Arma II before trying out Arma Tactics.

I'm struggling with why the developers called this game Arma Tactics.  Let's take the first word Arma.  Having played the first 2 Arma games, I assumed this game would have been along the same lines, but I quickly discovered this game has absolutely nothing in common with Arma or Arma II.  I mean I suppose I could say that Arma Tactics has soldiers firing weapons in it, but I am hard pressed to come up with any other similarities.

It's just odd because even in the limited time I spent with the first 2 Arma games, it was clear just how much depth was packed into each of these games.  If Arma II represents the deep end of my swimming pool, then Arma Tactics is the top step in the shallow end of the pool as I'm getting out.

Which brings me to the word tactics. I imagine this word was picked because you are leading your squad in tactical combat, ordering each of your members around.  I can see where this game is trying to be X-Com, but due to the lack of depth, it doesn't really succeed on any level.

I should also mention I wasn't a big fan of the camera.  I wouldn't say the camera is buggy or non-functional.  It's just I felt like I was constantly having to fiddle with the camera in order to get a decent view of my surroundings.

I started with the tutorial, which again, compared to the first 2 Arma games was extremely shallow.  It did at least get me started though, covering the basics of how to order my squad around, how to fire at enemies, and it also showed me how to do a takedown at close range.  The tutorial was extremely brief, and my first thought was that the developers just skimped a bit on this part.  But what I fear though is that they actually didn't skimp on the tutorial, it's just there's so little gameplay that needs to be covered.

My first mission consists of me and 2 squadmakes on a mission to take out some terrorists who are spread out along the map.  Gameplay takes place in turns as I move my squad around.  Each squad member gets 2 action points which can be spent on movement or a combination of movement and some other kind of action.  There's one exception though to the turn based gameplay, and that if you step into the line of sight of a terrorist as you are moving.  If this happens, the terrorist gets to interrupt you by shooting at you.  This will happen a lot because you don't know where the terrorists are to start with.  So inevitably you'll stumble across a group of them, and they'll likely get a free shot at you in the process.

I should mention, getting hit in this game is bad.  You can only take about 3 hits before you are knocked out.  I got a single medkit to start with which means I get one chance to heal one squad member.  Oh, and I did I mention that the mission ends when only one of your squad members dies?

Because of this, I quickly found my gameplay turning into what I would describe as Stealth and Error, where I would uncover terrorists, get shot lots of times, then reload with the precognitive knowledge of where they were hiding, and try something new.  I'm pretty sure this isn't the intended way of playing the game.

Suffice to say the difficulty is pretty high.  But the difference is, with Arma II, dying just inspired me to try harder.  I spent a good portion on my first hour in Arma II stuck on the first tutorial mission trying to take out an enemy squad.  But dying in this game doesn't feel like a teaching lesson.  It's just an annoyance.

Save yourself the trouble and try out a different Arma game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078523040', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1555555935}
review:
Para comenzar he leido muchas reviews de este juego pero en realidad yo, que lo he probado me animo a dar este analisis , espero lo encuentren util:

Es un juego de estrategias por turnos, el cual solo te indica el objetivo y depende de tus habilidades el como llegar, 
por lo cual aqui se pone a prueba tu "paciencia" ya que si quieres hacer un juego limpio, cada mision te puede llevar hasta una hora en completar.

No tiene muchas armas solo 4 clases: el rifle, la escopeta, el rifle de francotirador y la ametralladora.

Cada arma tiene unas mejoras que mas bien serian accesorios los cuales puedes comprar con ARMA POINT o "AP" los cuales ganas completando las misiones.

Tambien hay puntos de experiencia "EXP" los cuales los usas para mejorar las habilidades de tus personajes.

Como contras este juego posee bugs que en lo personal si me han molestado un poco pero no han afectado mi gameplay.
Espero que continuen solucionando estos problemas. ya que ahora con la ultima actualizacion ha tenido mejoras graficas y hasta ahora te da cromos :)  .

En resumen recomiendo este juego a las personas que les guste el genero, tendran horas de estrategias y villanos que nunca aparecen en el mismo lugar.

8/10   Nota final

author: {'steamid': '76561198046250428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1510094019}

This is a nice game. It's what you'd expect from a tactical shooter. 

Just don't play it on different computers, because the ONE THING that sucks, besides the americanism, 
is that the game FORCES you to go through "boot camp" every time you start the game from a different
computer. It simply locks all the other options out. I really really really hate this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026513613', 'num_games_owned': 1600, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1434256161}
review: Squad and turn based tactical experience pretty much like Jagged Alliance, XCOM etc. Not terrible but feels very clunky and unfinished. The idea is good, the execution pretty limited. Your soldiers are supposed to be badass tactical dudes but their range of actions and abilities is very limited, while poorly trained militias hardly ever seem to miss a shot. This is on top of a very confusing map and a rather poor camera system. Overall not recommended even on sale, it's just not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076227492', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1433758107}
review:
Im not sure why people are going ham about the graphics, this game originally was made for mobile and later on ported to PC. You shouldn't expect next gen graphics from it, also gameplay is far more important than graphics. I enjoyed playing this game on the highest difficulty available, it was a pretty nice challenge.

The only con is lack of missions, there's like 12 missions in the game, each one last 30 mins or so if you execute it perfectly. Also there's quite a few little bugs here and there, one is game breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035653328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1381697786}
review:
Ce jeu n'est clairement pas fini. Il y a plein d'elements bloquant qui se succedent, et ceux des le premier scenario. Il y a t'il seulement eut un effort de fait sur la Q&A?

Nul n'est oblige de perdre son temps sur un pareil produit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025583859', 'num_games_owned': 2759, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1433419406}
review: This game is not quite as bad as other reviews would make it seem... At its base it's actually a fairly nifty tactics thing, and I didn't encounter any bugs playing on Windows, other than an irritating problem where the correspondence between zoom and whether I looked inside or outside a building was off. The unfortunate part is it's obviously ported from a tablet, and uses captive audience mechanics; you have to buy your equipment and level your characters to proficiency using currency generated in-game. You don't really start out with a squad that makes the campaign winnable. I would actually recommend it for anyone with scads of free time... were it not for the price. You can find an ungracious time-sinkhole for less than $9 (in fact, it's fairly common practice now to give the sinkhole away for free and simply sell ladders).

author: {'steamid': '76561198038654689', 'num_games_owned': 972, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1433020886}
review: Not a terrible game, but not a good port. Very rough around the edges. I appreciate the work they did porting to Unity 5, for its a much more solid game than before. I've done some work with unity 5 and I've hated it since release, so I'm proud of them for getting past the obvious confusing setup changes and not charging for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021190833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1438209116}
review:
I have been on a bit of an arma binge recently, so I decided to give this game another shot. It seems that the devs. made some improvment as far as graphics and overall game play. The game is now playable yay! If you want to read my previous review that is at the bottom.

Ideal Price point would be below $2.

Pros:
Its a fun squad based game similar to Xcom but more realistic
Upgrades and XP keep me engaged

Cons:
Gameplay is still a bit clunky, supose I want to select a soldier to move him close to another one. The is a chance I could acidently try and heal that soldier which is a waste of a medpack which you have tobuy with coins (earned trhough playing the game)

The main guy (Ian) has a british accent but is in an american unit andhas a US flagpatch.... details man.

The voice overs are very canned

Missions are very short.



Previous Review:
So clunky and hard to move the camera/ the soldiers. I had set a low bar based on the review, but I was hoping to at least be entertained. I just got frustrated and stoped playing... its a bummer really, this is a really cool concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006909019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1431260061}
review:
Would not be such a bad game, if it didnt carry the ArmA title but as it does you kind of expect a game that works and can manage the gun mechanics. unfortutunaly however it feels clumsey half arsed and badly made. the controls are uncomfortable, the animations are basic, you get a total of 4 guns and a few 'items' and the spotting mechanic does not seem to work at all. If you want a good turn based game then try Xcom or Zenonaughts, something less sci fi then try any of the  jagged allience games (very good games with very similar style play maybe even the same engine with the newer ones but with more far more customisation, and rng, not the online one... shudders.)

ArmA tactics 3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061142815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1428977728}
review:
While looking for another tactic game, I've bought this in a bundle (if I'm not mistaken). Cut to the chase: Avoid it! Reasons:

1. How come you can't move the camera freely? You can drag it, but you can't rotate!
2. Your AP at first missions are very limited, so your full range movements are to be thought carefully, since you won't be able to act if you move your full range (and that means heal or defend yourself). Not good for a first experience.
3. Those controls! The heck!! The icons show over the characters and you can easily miss the command. That means, if you intend to shoot or heal, and miss, you're done.
4. First mission, 3 guys, very limited inventory (your items are counted as individuals, not per type), against up to 7 that clearly can move farther AND still shoot at you! Pretty unbalanced and aggresive, to be the first mission.
5. You can't see your enemies at first glance (which enforces you to explore the map), and that's good... Well, if you could move and act, that is.
6. It's not clear when the turn is finished, nor when a character's phase is done (you just find yourself unable to do anything, then you're asked for your next character).

author: {'steamid': '76561198001537536', 'num_games_owned': 1015, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1439284086}
review:
[b]VERDICT:[/b] A niche combat oriented game.  Simple yet comphrensive mechanics.  With lite roleplay and modest inventory options.  The game engine is solid if unimpressive.  Its an average game but it could have been the base for something greater.  Just a shame really that it wasnt successful enough for the developer to build upon it.  Dont expect it to be the next XCom or Jagged Alliance.  If you want something cheap, short and casual then its perfectly adequate.

NOTE: Last four broken achievements have been fixed. (Aug 11, 2015)
...

[b]01. GENRE:[/b] Tactical, squad, turn-based strategy game with lite roleplay elements.

[b]02. SETTING:[/b] Modern Day/Contemporary generic Middle-Eastern/North Africa.

[b]03. STORY/BACKGROUND:[/b] Take control of a squad of four army soldiers who must defeat generic terrorists in a variety of missions.

[b]04. GAME MODES:[/b] Singleplayer only.  Two five mission campaigns of around 1/2h to 3/4h each.  There is also a random mission generator where the team can face different objectives on different maps.

[b]05. GAMEPLAY:[/b] The Arma Tactics experience can be summed up as being; Ready your team.  Begin next mission. Complete one or more objectives. Keep your squad alive.  Kill or sneak past any enemies encountered.  Receive experience points and credits.  Boost your squads abilities.  Buy equipment, weapons or upgrades.  Rinse and repeat.  

Main aspects of gameplay involve movement and firearm based combat.  Supplemental actions add to the tactical play including: throwing grenades, planting mines, healing and reviving fallen comrades.  Inventory customization plays a small yet satisfying part of the game, allowing players to choose a weapon type for each soldier even if its from only four.  An additional four slots per soldier allow add. equipment to be carried, increasing the tactical options available.

Mission failure occurs if a team member dies.  The game has a good tutorial if you are unused to this type of game.

[b]06. MECHANICS:[/b] Core gameplay consist of standard tactical options.  Each soldier has two action points during a turn.  They can move or shoot, stab, heal, throw grenades, revive a dying soldier, plant or detonate claymore mine, take cover, attach silencers or reload ammo.  Line-of-sight adds a much needed layer of tactical playing and an element of stealth as the A.I. always begins unawares.  

The steamlined nature of combat is a real draw.  Select soldier, select target, choose shot type (aimed or snap).  It keeps the action flowing.  Soldiers that do not use all their (two) action points have a chance of a interrupt if an enemy attacks in range and in sight.  Any team member who loses all their health can be revived by another member of the team though, this must be done quickly within a time limit or they will expire. XP and credits are awarded for completing missions. XP is used to upgrade skills which affect action success.  These include: 4 weapon skills, tactical movement, medic, grenades, explosive and hand-to-hand combat.

Credits can be spent on purchasing weapons other than starting M-16 assualt rifles or upgrading eapons to boost their effectiveness with: larger ammo capacity, telescopic sights and silencers.  In additional consumable items such as: smoke, stun and frag grenades, medical kits, revive syringes, proximity and remote detonate claymores can be purchased to augment the tactical options available to each soldier. 

[b]07. A.I:[/b] Static with quick response options when an enemy spots a member of your team.  Namely it will usually kamikaze attack but look to flee if fire upon and alone.  As placement of enemies is pre-determined the A.I. doesnt have to be clever. While I would say it is robust it doesnt go far enough to provide a taxing challenge but I doubt it the game was ever designed to do that.

[b]08. GRAPHICS:[/b] Visually the game is fine.  Graphics are nothing amazing but in keeping with the general setting.  Models especially enemies are a variation on a standard.  Weapons are distinctly drawn.  Maps including furniture and terrain are fine if nothing special.  

[b]09. G.U.I/CONTROLS:[/b] Overall the G.U.I is fine.  Its standard select, point-and-click fare.  Aspects of combat such as choosing your shot type or performing an action other than shooting (healing, cover, reloading) is oriented around the focal point.  This I like.  Perhaps the worst aspect of the game is the sometimes fiddly nature of selecting the target spot when you move. Sometimes the click doesnt register and it can be annoying as hell.

[b]10. SOUNDTRACK & AUDIO:[/b] Basic enviromental noises.  No music in game.

[b]11. VOICE ACTING:[/b] Okay.  Probably one of the better aspects of the game.  The members of your squad render dialogue at key points in the mission, namely at the start, end and the completion of mission objectives.

[b]12. DIFFICULTY:[/b] There are no difficulity ratings.  The game is overall is pretty easy for a veteran tactical/strategy gamer. There are a few achievements that require some care and forethought but once the mechanics and the limitations of the A.I are understood, these should not be a problem.  If you are having problems then you can play a few short generated missions to upgrade your skills and buy better equipment or upgrades.

[b]13. PLAYTIME:[/b] You can complete the campaigns in between 6-10h.  It will take you less time if you do not replay the campaign missions, dont try out some of the random mission to buff your squad or dont aim to complete all the achievements.   My run took 15h but I replayed several campaign missions, played around a dozen randomly generated levels to earn additional xp to buff my team and earn extra credits to spend on equipment and weapon upgrades when I need to replay a mission.

[b]14. PROBLEMS:[/b] No major issues during my playthrough.  Perhaps the biggest gripe is the G.U.I. when selecting the location to move soldiers.  It can be tricky at the worst of times and cause a mistake to serverely hamper your mission progress.  That said though if you're careful you should be okay.

[b]15. ACHIEVEMENTS:[/b] The game has achievements but the developer/publisher hasnt setup their store page correctly to show them.  Of the twenty-two two are campaign based, four are objectives based and the others are action-based (kill x soldiers with a weapon, heal team members y times, etc.) 

[b]16. DLC:[/b] None and there are unlikely to be any.

[b]17. FUN FACTOR:[/b] There is a fair amount of fun in commanding your squad through each mission.  Squad and inventory/equipment manage is pretty good.  Despite its fairly casual nature I would wager definitely only fans of the genre are going to like it.  If you are drawn here by the 'Arma' in the title, stop.  Dont be.  It really couldnt be more different.  

[b]18. CHALLENGE:[/b] The game only provides a taxing challenge in the later levels when enemies are deployed in larger numbers and in greater proximity.  Even then it is rather forgiving in that you can restart the game with your squad intact and only equipment used missing from your inventory. There are no other penalties.  If you ever find yourself out of credits to purchase equipment you may need, a few runs on the mission generator will be enough. The final two missions have a nice twist to them. :)

[b]19. LONGEVITY/REPLAYABILITY:[/b] Fairly low as despite having a random mission generator, playing and replaying the same missions does eventually get tiresome.  Especially once youve boosted your squads stats to their max. and have enough credits to buy every item, weapon and upgrade there is.

[b]20. VALUE FOR MONEY:[/b] Not worth it at full price but not far off.  The game is too short and only worth the consideration at 50% or more discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074086207', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1419121322}
review:
Well, this game starts off really bad. There are severe bugs that need to be dealt with, for example: in the tutorial (medpack part). This may throw you down a lot, but once you somehow manage to overcome it, this game is actually... pretty boring. Yes, it is a tactics and turn based game, but it offers so little in return, it's actually mediocre.

The gameplay is average, you can do the typical, but not any more, it's always the same. The levels are really unbalanced, there are parts where it's impossible to pass and parts where you wonder what you are actually doing. It can get tedious, very tedious at times, and the only way to get past it is to farm abilities or points to allocate to your squad, which is really tiring.

Once you get a decent setup, you can actually get to one of the last missions. To be blown up by very bad calibrated mortars and shredded to pieces in a 1 hit kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1420975643}
review:
I will first start out by saying that I am not a fan of the stratergy genre so that has influence my view on Arma Tactics. Firstly the tutorial is worthless, you end up skipping most of the "lessons" by actually testing out what you have learned because the left mouse button also acts as a skip button for some reason. 

This game is brutally hard, you instantly get a mission fail if one of your guys dies, because as they keep repeating through the whole game "No one gets left behind". You are sadly limited to very few medic packs which you use to revive your injuryed party members, so if you loose more than one ally, you basically just need to restart the level as they are very hard to come by. 

Graphics are not the usual Arma standard, but I wouldn't expect anything different from a stratergy title. 

Fans of the series and this type of game will probably get some enjoyment out of it, but its not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982620421', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1420313153}
review: Voice acting sounded like random people off the street reading a script they had never seen before. Enemies would disappear (yes, ever after the patch that supposedly fixed this). Tool-tips had extensive typos. Controls were sloppy and uncustimizable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061646276', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1384614160}
review:
I didn't like XCOM as much as I'd hoped to, but I still prefer it over Arma Tactics. (Although I'm the kind of person who'd rather play Wasteland 2 or Valkyria Chronicles.)
I haven't played the "new" Jagged Alliance or Door Kickers but I suggest people curious of Arma Tactics to check those out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070108772', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1701454233}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089633961', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1419268776}
review: Just.... no.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963161776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1453985467}
review:
This game could be fun but needs a lot of improvement. The mechanics and content are very limited, and most importantly there are a lot of issues.

This game is a badly done smartphone port. The controls are uncomfortable on a computer, and there's issues with the camera. For example, it's sometimes difficult to position the camera properly to see under/around parts of the terrain, such as the bridge in the first mission of the second campaign.

There are also several game-breaking bugs that make it hard, if not impossible, to complete missions. I've seen enemies shooting through roofs and even enemies triggering cut scenes and events that only the player is supposed to trigger, thus ruining a long and difficult mission just near the end, and making it impossible to complete the first mission of a campaign.

The devs don't seem to respond to bug reports anymore and have apparently left these game-breaking bugs there for the players to deal with.

Don't buy this game, unless you like bugs or enjoy spending money on a game that cannot be completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067619085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1449935581}
review:
The game itself, is not bad actually, you need to make every move count so if you are a Strategy Worm you would really like it.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198096674207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1412074468}
review: It reminds me of an old game, "Commandos" but it is more freely moving. Every choice and move matters and that is the good thing. You don't have to shoot and run, it needs strategy. It is like I train my brain every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970631574', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1460902174}
review: This is a surprisingly fun game to play once you learn the controls. The AI is what it is, but for the most part the game is very enjoyable and a bargain for $10 (or less). It is kind of like Full Spectrum Warrior, but has enough of its own personality to make it a worthwhile gaming investment. It is actually quite nice looking in terms of graphics as well, and has one of the best implementations of an in-mission map overlay that I have seen in any video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033868502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1494599881}
review: As a mad Fallout Tactics fan I just had to get this. At it's original release it was a little limiting and had a few game breaking bugs which probably leads to it's initial bad wrap. Do not be fooled however, this game has come a long way with updates, and extra campaigns. This is well worth the asking price now if not more so ($8.99 at time of writing). If turn based shooters like Xcom, Jaggard Alliance and Fallout are your thing add this to your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046675266', 'num_games_owned': 1539, 'num_reviews': 1124, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1435357252}

[h1]It's a shame to see this carry the title of ArmA, but I'm not one for Turn Based Stratedy games, yawn...
Oh and the menu screen used the same lines from Red Alert 1/2 Hell March theme song, nice.

Shitty tutorial and gameplay, you're better off playing any other type of shooter game, especially without annoying British people yelling at you.

0/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198011153131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1506839170}
review: It's an alright game, but I wouldn't really recommend this game. Very basic plot, poor dialogue, very little to customize, hard to start off in the gmae. There are no achievements in the game even though it says there are some there, you cannot earn any of the achievements listed at all, I dunno why, but probably because the games bugged too muchâ€¦ If you really want to play this game, just get yourself CheatEngine or GameConqueror and look for the HEX Data for Credits to max it out just so you can purchace XP, Weapons and Skill upgrades to play through the game with fair chance of survival to beat the game. I don't normally condone cheating in games, but this is plenty worth cheating your way through this game since there's nothing significant to get out of playing it, and its only Single Player game anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043971033', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1408315171}
review:
Modern military squad/turn-based strategy brought to you by people who make great simulation games (especially military ones)! Sounds pretty great right? WRONG. Everything about this game is poorly done. Ahem. For instance, cover doesn't matter, a grenade will stop pretty much immediately as soon as it touches something (You know how bouncing/rolling grenades are actual military and videogame techniques? Not here), AI is incredibly stupid and are perfectly unaware of anything SPRINTING behind them and is totally willing to stand out in the open instead of laying traps or taking cover (which would really be a great idea, because my men are so accurate that the game isn't even close to a challenge when fighting at range), and the UI sucks and results in a mess of missclicks. Still not convinced this game is bad? There is no music, the sound effects are completely uninmpressive, the visuals are just okay, the squad isn't remotely worth listening to, any items you use on a mission have to be bought with credits beforehand (and you have to either grind or be efficient to get them), and worst of all is that amongst only 10 or so premade missions and some badly constructed random missions is that THE GAME HAS NO MULTIPLAYER. And none of this helps how horribly buggy it is too. Frequently my men would stop dead a few paces away from where I told them to go. Locations that were totally accesible were avoided by my men, and areas that you couldn't pass a grenade through they were willing to try. I got shot though walls twice in ten minutes.

TL;DR: Everything is shittily slapped together and it's not even good for a laugh or a quick game with some friends. A game that could have been a great battle of wits has no multiplayer to speak of. Heartbreaking really. 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961161813', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1406431055}
review:
Spending just a bit of time with ARMA Tactics, I had high hopes as I love tactical turn-based strat games. Regrettably, this game turned out to be a serious letdown with no reward.

The premise is you control a tactical ops team of 4 soldiers, doing various missions in the middle-east.....yep pretty generic set piece.

After completing the tutorial, it seemed like it was going to be fairly solid in terms of gameplay, but this quickly transitioned to the first level being massive and extremely challenging (set on default difficulty). After 30min and struggling with bugs and poor input for the soliders, I lost 1 solider and lost the game. Quite frankly it was a rage quit at that point.

The game is need of serious balancing, and another pass at controls. Too many options overlap just mouse-clicking which in turn creates incidents of mis-set actions, which 'could' have been mitigated with an undo option....but nope.

I appreciate the genre they tackled here, but it's a game that just doesn't come together sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966164461', 'num_games_owned': 990, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1406322618}
review:
Despite moments of brilliance, this game is exceptionally buggy.

Generally, ARMA tactics is a decent, but limited, turn-based tactics game.  The turn system, action points, and interrupt systems are all pretty standard but well implemented.  The level designs are OK and the graphics aren't bad either.  Unfortunately, all of this is rendered moot by an avalanche of bugs that make the game nearly unplayable.  Little things like:
1)  The "Continue" button (which should continue your game from the last mission you were on) on the Main Menu doesn't work and typically just hangs the program.
2)  Building a custom mission and selecting "Random" for the map type always results in the first map (African Town I) being chosen.
3)  Custom mission type "Terrorist Hunt" results in the terrorist you are hunting LITERALLY DISAPPEARING OFF THE MAP, making it impossible to complete the mission.
4)  Multiple bugs in campaign missions making them impossible to complete without replaying repeatedly and hoping not to encounter the bug.
5)  Weapon modeling is nearly non-existent.  While the sniper rifle has a longer range and appears to crit more often, M-4s and SAWs do about the same damage at about the same range... with no suppress function for the SAW.

Bottom line:  at $9 it is OK, but extremely frustrating.  Suggest X-COM or one of the Jagged Alliance sequels instead

author: {'steamid': '76561197987292682', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 319, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1410105640}
review:
A big disappointment. I was a fan of both the first ARMA games (played original operation flashpoint and ARMA 1 and 2), and a fan of tactical turn based strategy games, like Jagged Alliance, 7.62 high caliber and Silent Storm. This game will not appeal to fans of either genre, as is not as near as â€œrealisticâ€ as the ARMA series, nor a heavy tactical game. Itâ€™s more like casual tactics for the casual gamer. In games like Jagged Alliance you could shoot from different positions (standing, kneeling, prone) and spend AP to aim (a â€œsnapshotâ€ or a â€œaimed shotâ€). In this game you donâ€™t have any of that, and can only choose form spending 2 AP or 1 on a shot, but no further aiming gameplay.
The story is non existent. Itâ€™s just a straight forward army game (maybe the only aspect similar to the original ARMA series) against your random â€œterroristâ€. You cantâ€™ â€œbuildâ€ your team, since you canâ€™t choose your solders, and both the experience system (to improve skills) and the weapon system are very limited. Another drawback for me was that you canâ€™t really build â€œrandom missionsâ€ like in the ARMA series, you can just replay the maps with different goals, but not really design a mission.
It might be a good cellphone game, but itâ€™s totally out of league for a PC game.

I payed less than 2 dollars for it, since I bought it on sale, and still feel I payed to much. AVOID this game, you are better of buying XCOM or Jagged Alliance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989885643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1404994999}
review: As a huge fan of turn based strategy game I was very disappointed with this title. The tutorial seemed like it may be a good game, but on the first mission I ran into too many issues to continue playing. Shooting an enemy at point blank range with an M4 did not kill the enemy. Also, cover is always huge in TBS games and both my squad and the enemies were able to shoot through walls. What's the point of using strategy and position if you can just shoot through walls? Waste of time/money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989224389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1471671850}
review:
The game is relatively short.  But you can replay it.  I had a great time playing it.  

It has a Demo if you want to try it out before you buy it.  Recommended.

If you have problems starting the game set the version to developer mode to get it to work.  Right click on game in your steam library and look at the different tabs.  Similar to setting it to how you would set other games to beta mode in the steam profile, only its called developer mode instead of beta mode. 

I'm hoping they come out with more missions and add ons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019327613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1417220232}
review:
When I booted up Arma:Tactics I saw what I wanted to see out of the whole arma franchise,the franchise was just asking to make it an strategy game.The only thing I would recommend to the creators is to follow the steps of the Wargame series with the graduall expansion of the content,because it does lack some of it.

+Story Line

-No vehicles
-Not as many weapons as you thought

Overall Score: 1/2  -Like I said it does lack some content so it dosn't seem fair to judge it by my professional score system,that's why it's only half of what it could be,"Expansion could make it better...no,they will"

author: {'steamid': '76561197972670619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1401626171}
review:
Very very poor. Buggy, with a very poor layout and very limited tactical options.

You can't even choose the direction you face your claymore mines for gods sake, so you have to waste a whole action point turning your inept stupid soldier around so he doesn't kill your whole squad by arming a claymore in their face....

The chances to hit are random, sometimes grenades go off by enemies feet and do no damage, cover is basically meaningless.

Voice acting and the writing is terrible. Really this game was rushed out to make a few bucks out of people who like squad turn based strategy. Don't buy it, even on offer I regret the Â£1.xx I paid for this lump of steaming .... you get the picture.

2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971110079', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1446691111}
review:
You should know that this is actually a port of a mobile game. It's simplified, but it still enjoyable enough. No, it's not Jagged Allience, and it's no where near the full Arma games, but it works. 

There is a good deal of frustation when it comes to the interface. It's not good about telling you how many AP remain, nor how much you'll spend moving to a given point. More than likely, you'll find yourself moving to places accidentally, ruining whole turns.

Don't buy it at full price, but on sale for a buck or two, it's not bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137135249', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1401123604}
review:
I'm still going to give this game some more chance.. may change to positive review later. But for now, kind of annoyed / bored by it, with less than an hour in. Played the tutorial, which is fine. The voice acting tries a little too hard and is kind of annoying. Would rather there be no story than an annoying one. The camera controls also end up being annoying, when you're dragging your soldier's footpath, the camera doesn't automatically follow toward your destination, so you have to stop, move the camera, then try again. 

I gave it another try recently and played the first mission. Turns out, if one of your guys dies, and you don't have anyone to stabilize him, then game over. No permadeath allowed. Pfft. Annoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008921247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1398787718}
review:
There is definitely some potential in this game - and it's not without some play value. (I spent 11 hours playing it, after all - enough to complete one of the two available story campaigns.)  That said, it feels a bit incomplete...  only one weapon of each type to unlock, only a very basic selection of non-weapon gear, no advancement aside from raising scores on a few basic skills which boil down to "walking", "shooting", etc.  If there was a bit more depth here, I'd definitely recommend, but as things stand, the poor AI and shaky gameplay make this a thumbs-down.  A few examples:

With 2 AP per character per turn, a lot of the tactical decisions involve guesswork.  A few examples of the sort of tactical frustration you'll encounter:

 "I guess moving here will give me line of sight to that exposed enemy...  hm, nope, invisible wall blocks my shot.  Guess I'll wait til next turn"

"I guess I'll wait here in overwatch so the enemy will come to me, since none of my guys have good LOS...  hm, nope, they shuffled a half step and hit everyone - I guess that low wall wasn't really giving me cover in that direction"

It's a shame, because this game is very close to being a great high-value squad tactics game.  A few quick fixes to gameplay, and/or some added content (more campaign levels, advancement options, gear, etc) would make this a definite winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101891520', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1400419691}
review:
For the money i paid (1.72) it is good. I got this game in the Bohemia sale. I think it is good for the money i paid, i wouldnt pay any more than three dollars for it, 
POSITIVE THINGS: 
High Framerate
Okay Storyline
Great Mission Setups
Good Loudout Menu

There arent really any negative things i can say about this game other than it is kind of buggy, and the cinematics are pretty bad. 

I have played this game for maybe an hour and i would definently play it in the future, I see myself playing when i have no internet connection, i am traveling, or none of my friends are on to play any other game. 

This game is realistic somewhat, Realism meaning the squad gameplay, you move up with your squad and you can only move one character 10 meters i think that is great because it is a close quarters combat game, and you dont want to move up 50 meters with any one guy (unless you know what you are doing). 

If there was a way to integrate multiplayer that would be awesome, a 4v4 Deathmatch with no respawns, 8 rounds max that would be amazing. You can communicate with your squad and play as a team overall, or you can be the lone wolf and go snipe on top of a building. each player should get a max of 30 seconds to move, that would be great in my opinion. 

ANY FPS GAMER WOULD LOVE THIS GAME

Overall i give this game a 8/10 
It is great and i love it. 
Thanks for reading and GAME ON

author: {'steamid': '76561197965196232', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1419621610}
review:
Petit jeu pas mauvais du tout, un mixte entre Xcom (le dernier) et Frontline Tactics (plus proche de ce dernier), avec un game play simple, rapide de prise en main et stratÃ©gique, il va falloir utiliser au mieux les diffÃ©rents couverts du jeu (vous ou un pas beau derriÃ¨re un mur on vous touche plus) savoir contourner Ã§a cible, utiliser le couteau ou les silencieux â€¦ et co.

Par contre  il peut Ãªtre amÃ©liorer, dÃ©jÃ  avoir un choix plus vaste au niveau des armes (que 4 armes lÃ ), supprimer ce systÃ¨me de 2 actions par perso par un bon vieux systÃ¨me Ã  l'ancienne une bonne vielle barre d'action (ici les 2 PA sont moins soÃ»lant que dans Xcom) et soyons fou pourquoi pas un Ã©diteur de map le jeu si prÃªte bien.

HÃ©las pas mal de petit bug â€¦ dÃ©jÃ  Ã©viter les toits on voie Ã  travers le plancher (et Ã§a marche dans les 2 sens). Certaines map dÃ©raillent un peu, lâ€™intÃ©rieur du barrage en partie libre l'ennemi ne fini jamais son 1er tour (alt+f4 -_-) la mission Ombre petit bug dans la misse Ã  jour des objectifs qui peu vous forcer Ã  recommencer si on fait comme moi la 1er fois: mettre les 4 commandos Ã  la mm sortie.

Pas moche peu mieux faire, attendez toute fois une promo 7euro c'est un peu trop chÃ¨re lÃ .

author: {'steamid': '76561197972308098', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1445018719}
review:
Unfortunatly I wasn't able to get very far into this game due to the bugs present in the game, and the poor interface. This appears to be a quickly put together clone of the wildly popular, and good, game XCOM Enemy Unknown. However, this is also a poorly done port of a mobile game which explains the terrible interface for a PC, and likely the number of bugs.

Turn-based games are my favorite kind of game. But this one was just too poorly implemented for me to even play it very long.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984743364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1496052314}
review:
This is an awesome game! BUT DO NOT BUY IT...YET!

If you enjoy games like fallout tactics, you will likely love this.
It is a great game I had hours of real enjoyment.

My pain is that there is a bug mid way in the game, I cant complete it the game.
There seems to be no desire to fix this issue. 
Wait for this game to hit a special of under $10 and buy it.
That being said buy it right now at the time of writing this the cost is $8.99 and I think that game even broken is worth it.
I do not feel it is worth $14 in a state where I can not complete the game.

If you could complete the game I would pay over $30 for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064156757', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 59908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11323, 'playtime_at_review': 5595, 'last_played': 1710406673}
review:
Arma Tactics is a turn-based close-combat strategy game, where you take control of a four-member Special Forces team. There are no given strategies, rails to move on, or paths to follow; itâ€˜s up to you to decide how you will play through both the story-driven missions and generated missions with randomized objectives. Whether using stealth or a more direct approach, you will need to use your strategic thinking and use both basic and advanced weaponry while facing many different opponents - ranging from unorganized local militia to smart and skilled mercenaries.

With highly replayable missions, achievements, weapons to unlock and two single-player campaigns, Arma Tactics offers many hours of intense ever-changing action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037528066', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1393741528}
review:
Just got this game from the Bohemia Humble Bundle. first, this game was made for mobile devices, just ported to PC, so the graphics doesn't look that good, the game is lacking for a typical tactical squad strategy game and it is very, very, different, from the main series ArmA.  so even if you like the ArmA games, there's no guarantee you will like this one.

Not recommended from a PC standpoint, from a mobile device point of view, a decent game.

If you are looking for a tactical game like this for PC, get XCOM: Enemy Unknown instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019355296', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1664451600}
review:
I love this game, it's really fun. I think it's in alpha or something because it says "press Y" and "press X" and displays buttons on an Xbox controller at times, crashes a few times and is kinda buggy so I'm not sure if they're fixing that but I can live with it.
This is a tactical turnbased shooter. You can customize your 4 soldiers with one of four weapons; either an assault rifle, a shotgun, a sniper or an LMG, and they all work like you'd expect them to. You get credits after each mission to spend on upgrading the weapons or buying medpacks and grenades and stuff like that for your soldiers.
I love this game because it's so tactical, it feels just like playing ArmA except everything is turn-based. You place your marksman on a remote roof overlooking everything, the LMG guy gets into a position with clear view while your assault guys move up and advance on the enemy, and then you just let it rip.
Like I said, it's kinda buggy at times, like sometimes it's almost impossible to avoid pressing the melee button even though you're not actually pressing it (the button for melee is at an enemy's feet while you're close to him) and you end up meleeing an enemy even though you didn't want to and you don't have time to get to cover and you get downed. Stuff like that but they may have fixed it, haven't played this in forever.
This game is like an 8/10 or a 9/10. Only reason that I haven't played more is because there's a campaign and not a set of randomly generated missions so it's kind of boring to play over and over again, unless you wait a few months before doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990523893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1659564247}
review:
Arma Tactics is a very basic turn based strategy game where you command a small squad of men. Similiar to XCOM, Jagged Alliance 2, or stuff like that.

Its okay its the core design of a possibly good and deep game here but the only problem its not deep. If you play the first mission the rest are basically the same thing over and over. There are only 3 weapons, LMB, AR, and Sniper rifle, and affording the sniper is a pain in the butt because grenades and medkits. You can upgrade your squad members but you need to exit to the main menu then go back into the game. Its idiotic and on top of that the upgrades don't make a huge diffrence so its like why bother? And unless you explore the menu you would probably never know you could even upgrade them.

Its extremely basic and would be great as a pick up and play...mobile...game....on android....iOS
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARMA_Tactics
WELL WHAT DO YOU KNOW. Thats what it is. Unfortunately its a game thats main focus was a mobile market. So pick up and play was what they wanted. And since most people don't want a hardcore deep game while on the train or waiting room its fairly basic like solitaire or checkers. So if I had played this on a mobile setting I would have probably enjoyed it though I find it strange that it has no PSVita port or WiiU or even a home console version.

The AI is nothing special and will just throw men at you most the time so its relatively easy. The only challenge comes from when your men keep missing over and over or when AI just thrown at you en masse to the point it just makes you lose man after man because you simply can't handle the amount its throwing at you.

Its not bad but theres just not much content here. Thers nothing really to say about it I guess. They could have gone buckwild and added a metric done of content like in Arma 2 comparatively.

But what is bad I have noticed is that sometimes enemies can shoot you through walls or ceilings which is just plain bullcrap. Aswell at one point I was detected while trying to do a stealth mission and a squad mate got wounded when shot through a window. Except it was one of those type of windows game designers put in a map or area to fill up space and you cant see through because the glass is blocked with newspapers or some crap. In any other game you would expect that window to be basically just a painting on the wall in terms of gameplay. But instead the AI can see and shoot through it but you cant! Shooting through walls gets really annoying but this is just idiotic.  Sometimes grenades will hit something in the air you can't seen and not go where you want them to at all, and much more annoyingly your well trained and well armed American soldeirs will miss a shot directly in front of them while Jihadis mess them up in all kinds of Mujah ways. This randomness can really drain you from wanting to play the game along with casually enraging you. 

So to sum this up, its just okay. Not worth much more than $5 if you want to play it on a stationary system but a worthy diversion if you want to blow 20 to 30 minutes waiting for something. But if you want something more deep than a very bare bones TBS there are better games for you such as Expeditions: Conquistador or either of the ones mentioned at the start. If you have a mobile device I would atleast consider buying this game along with GTA Vice City and Max Payne 1 (both on Android market).

Its really not that fun though unless you play it in short spurts to waste time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994681687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1490141632}
review: New to the Arma community? Then this is the worst game to buy. Please try an Arma that feels more complete, such as Arma 2 or Arma 3 or even just plain old Arma. This game manages to make the AI in Arma feel actually less intelligent then  in Arma 2. So yeah, unless you happened to receive this game along with the Humble Bundle, save your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036082570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1420930532}
review:
I played for a bit and already noticed some bugs, like when you try to move a soldier somewhere he cannot get to because the path is blocked by other soldiers, the game will not advance (smoke still plays, but the soldier will just be standing there and nothing happens). Also, when you decide to restart a mission you lose your bought gear and points?
I got the game from the Humble Bundle and not directly from Steam, but I wouldn't recommend on buying it. If you are a hardcore fan of this genre, try other games (other reviewers name them). If you're more like me, and just want to try out something new, this game COULD be fun for you, if you don't mind the bugs. Cannot say too much about the story at this point, but I actually like the graphics in this game - not too overwhelming but not bad either. Gameplay is quite simple but by no means easy (at least for me). If you already have it or get it as a gift, try it, otherwise you might want to think twice about buying it on Steam.

review: Feels unfinished. In only half an hour, I encountered alot of game breaking bugs. F.ex getting shot through walls (in spots that clearly shows this is not an intended feature), and game hanging on "Enemy turn". With the current state of the game, I would not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068920878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1410536231}
review:
The basic idea was sound : a turn based tactical game. 

10 maps, I can't say how disappointed I am by this small fact...

The IA sucks. 

The levelling is tedious, and it does not make that big a difference. A weapon skill at 25 gives you like 5% more chances to hit. The number generator is also odd, I've just missed twice in a row on a 85% chance to hit...

Maybe, with 2 or 3 additionnal campaigns, it might become an interesting game. As it is, I'll recommend to avoid it at all costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977470600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1451171937}
review:
I like this game much more than I thought I would.  I expecially like that it's a linux title too, so I can play it cross platform on whatever I choose.  It certainly needs some more time in BI's oven, as do most of their games.  But like the rest of their games, it's built on a very solid foundation that will continue to improve for the life of the game.  

I like the game as is, and I know from experience that it was a sound investment in terms of entertainment value.  It'll only get better, too.
